b'Will there be more Gilmore Girls? Recently, stars Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel discussed the possibility of another Netflix revival, Deadline reports.

This past November, the streaming service debuted Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life\xe2\x80\x94a four-part follow-up to the original WB/CW series. The cast included Graham, Bledel, Kelly Bishop, Scott Patterson, Keiko Agena, Sean Gunn, Matt Czuchry, Milo Ventimiglia, and Yanic Truesdale.

During a recent panel, Graham said she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t think there\xe2\x80\x99s a need for more Gilmore Girls:

I love her writing; from the moment I read the pilot, I felt so connected to Amy Sherman-Palladino\xe2\x80\x99s voice as a writer. It was so invigorating and fulfilling to do that work. In terms of an actor, I would never tire of that. Now it has become, \xe2\x80\x98What can we do that is satisfying, and worth continuing, and gratifying to the people who care so much about it.\xe2\x80\x99 I don\xe2\x80\x99t know if there is a need to do more. I would never want it to feel like we overstayed our welcome. \xe2\x80\xa6 There\xe2\x80\x99s probably a way to keep these characters alive but I don\xe2\x80\x99t know if that\xe2\x80\x99s the best thing for them.\xe2\x80\x9d

Bledel mentioned she isn\xe2\x80\x99t sure if she\xe2\x80\x99d dive back in for another season:

I think for me it comes down to what story we\xe2\x80\x99re telling. I\xe2\x80\x99m just interested in telling a story that is dynamic and that I sort of relate to and can hook into. And if that happens \xe2\x80\xa6 I don\xe2\x80\x99t know. It\xe2\x80\x99s such an unknown, I don\xe2\x80\x99t think we anticipated that this would happen.\xe2\x80\x9d

Later, Bledel revealed the ending of Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life was not what she was expecting:

It certainly wasn\xe2\x80\x99t the ending I was expecting. I told Amy that I hoped Rory would end on a high note. After all her hard work, I wanted to see her succeed and be thriving. So it was a hard thing for me to digest. I was hoping that we would see that she had lived an interesting life and had been fulfilled up until this point where her grandfather dies and [she] comes back home. But, because I know Amy after all these years, I knew it was her true intention and it was something that satisfied her as a writer because she knew the reaction she was going to get from the audience. \xe2\x80\xa6 So I trusted her.\xe2\x80\x9d

What do you think? Are you a fan of Gilmore Girls? Do you think there should be more episodes?'

b'Getty Images

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, Prince William and Prince Harry united yesterday to honor the fallen soldiers of the Battle of Vimy Ridge in 1917. Trudeau, the royal brothers and their father Prince Charles gathered at Vimy Memorial Park in northern France on Sunday for a ceremony marking the 100th anniversary of the World War I battle.

France's president Fran\xc3\xa7ois Hollande led the ritual, which included speeches from Trudeau and Prince Charles. An estimated 20,000 Canadians were in attendance.

Both Prince William and Prince Harry laid down a pair of boots to commemorate those who fought in battle.

b'Selena Gomez and '13 Reasons Why' Castmates Got Matching Tattoos

For a good cause.

Selena Gomez has spoken at length about the personal significance of the new Netflix series 13 Reasons Why, which tells the story of the thirteen reasons why a bullied high school student commits suicide. Gomez, who, along with her mom, pushed for the series to be made, served as an executive producer on the show.

"I would do anything to be able to have a good influence on this generation, but I definitely relate to everything that was going on," said the 24-year-old during a Netflix press event in February. "I was there for the last episode, and I was a mess just seeing it all come to life, because I've experienced that."

Now, the story is getting even more personal for Gomez. Along with two of the show's breakout stars, Tommy Dorfman (who plays Ryan Shaver) and Alisha Boe (Jessica Davis), the pop star got a semicolon tattoo over the weekend to represent Project Semicolon, a suicide prevention and mental health awareness organization. The symbolic punctuation represents the idea that when one thought ends, a new one begins \xe2\x80\x94 that "this is not the end but a new beginning."

The trio showed off the matching ink on Instagram. "Project Semicolon is a movement dedicated to presenting hope for those suffering from depression, thoughts of suicide, addiction, and self-injury," captioned Boe on her Instagram.

Dorfman also describes his own personal struggles with mental health in his past. "I struggled with addiction and depression issues through high school and early college," he wrote alongside a photo of the gang's matching tattoos. "I reached out and asked for help. At the time, I thought my life was over, I thought I'd never live past the age of 21. Today I'm grateful to be alive, in this new chapter of life in recovery, standing with my colleagues and friends, making art that helps other people."'

b"A woman has given birth at more than 42,000 feet with the help of her husband and the cabin crew after going into labour during a flight.

Musuamba Michoukayembe, from the Democratic Republic of Congo, went into labour three hours into a flight from the Gabonese capital, Libreville, to Turkey's biggest city Istanbul.

The 21-year-old's husband,who is a doctor, and the cabin crew immediately began preparing for the birth, isolating an area at the back of the Turkish Airlines plane.

Ms Michoukayembe gave birth to a healthy baby boy, named Bennel, some 42,650 feet (13,000 metres) above the Republic of Niger in north-western Africa.

The crew of Turkish Airlines with newborn baby Bennel, who was born on board at 42,650 feet, while travelling from Gabon to Istanbul

Pilot Alper Akkaya said: 'The cabin crew established the necessary co-ordination and the baby was born after a healthy delivery. Fortunately, his father was a doctor, he helped us a lot.'

He revealed he had requested a priority landing, as well as an ambulance and doctors, shortly before entering Turkish airspace.

Mr Akkaya added: 'We completed this beautiful event in a healthy way. If it had not been a healthy birth, we would have diverted to another airport. But since it was healthy, we continued our four-hour flight.'

When the plane touched down in Istanbul, the new parents and the baby were taken to the nearest hospital in the Yesilkoy neighbourhood of the city.

The healthy baby boy, named Bennel, was born above the Republic of Niger in north-western Africa with the help of his doctor father and the cabin crew

Purser Fatma Akyuz said it had been an exciting flight: 'We boarded with 144 passengers, but landed with 145 passengers. It was a beautiful moment for us,' she said.

Cabin crew member Ilayda Erhalac said the pregnant woman had been quiet and relaxed during takeoff but had gone into labour three hours later.

She said: 'We prepared for the birth of our newest friend in a matter of minutes. We dealt with it professionally and everything turned out well.'"

b'The following story contains major spoilers about Homeland\xe2\x80\x98s Season 5 finale. Stop reading if the episode is still sitting on your DVR.

Homeland ended its fifth season Sunday with the presumed death of Rupert Friend\xe2\x80\x99s Quinn.

His already-bleak condition took a turn for the worse when the super-sniper suffered a brain hemorrhage. Even if he was to recover, he would\xe2\x80\x99ve been left with severe brain damage, his doc explained to Carrie. That prompted Carrie to remove his pulse monitor before \xe2\x80\x94 presumably \xe2\x80\x94 pulling the plug (or smothering him?) in the episode\xe2\x80\x99s closing minutes. (Or did Quinn stop breathing on his own, as one reader noted in the comments below?) Earlier, Dar handed her the letter Quinn had written her at the end of last season on the off chance he didn\xe2\x80\x99t survive that covert Syrian mission.

Here\xe2\x80\x99s the full text of his heartbreaking farewell note:

Carrie. I guess I\xe2\x80\x99m done. And we never happened. I\xe2\x80\x99m not one for words, but they\xe2\x80\x99re coming now. I don\xe2\x80\x99t believe in fate, or destiny, or horoscopes, but I can\xe2\x80\x99t say I\xe2\x80\x99m surprised things turned out this way. I always thought there was something kind of pulling me back to darkness. But I wasn\xe2\x80\x99t allowed a real life. Or a real love. That was for normal people. With you I thought maybe just maybe. But I know now that was a false glimmer. I\xe2\x80\x99m used to\xe2\x80\xa6 they happen all of the time in the desert, but this one got to me. And here\xe2\x80\x99s the thing, this death, this end of me is exactly what should\xe2\x80\x99ve happened. I wanted the darkness. I f\xe2\x80\x94ing asked for it. And it has me now. So don\xe2\x80\x99t put a star on the wall for me. Don\xe2\x80\x99t say some dumb speech. Just think of me as a light on the heavens. A beacon. Steering you clear of the wrongs. I loved you. \xe2\x80\x94Yours, for always now, Quinn.

(Quick sidebar: While it\xe2\x80\x99s true we didn\xe2\x80\x99t actually see Carrie pull the plug, given the extent of Quinn\xe2\x80\x99s brain injury, Homeland would risk mass ridicule if it returned in Season 6 with Quinn still alive; he\xe2\x80\x99s dead, people.)

Other highlights from Season 5\xe2\x80\x99s final hour:

* The chemical weapons attack in the Berlin subway station was averted, thanks to Carrie and good samaritan Qasim (may he R.I.P.).

* Saul cut a deal with Ivan \xe2\x80\x94 witness protection in the U.S. in exchange for delivering the duplicitous Allison to him. He came through with his end of the bargain, pinpointing Allison\xe2\x80\x99s whereabouts as she was being smuggled across the border in the trunk of a black sedan. The second the vehicle was in his sights, Saul ordered it fired upon; Allison was killed instantly.

RELATED \xe2\x80\x98Homeland Is Racist\xe2\x80\x99 Message Sneaks Into Season 5 Episode; EP Responds

* Laura and Numan were arrested by the BND for the role they played in stealing those sensitive documents. Astrid then floated a deal by Laura \xe2\x80\x94 publicly throw the late Marwan under the bus and, in return, her hacker buddy Numan won\xe2\x80\x99t be deported. Laura reluctantly accepted it. (I\xe2\x80\x99m gonna miss that scowl of hers.)

* Carrie and Jonas had makeup sex and then he promptly dumped her.

* Carrie \xe2\x80\x94 via Saul \xe2\x80\x94 was offered by the CIA a chance to \xe2\x80\x9cpick her next mission, design your own team\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 a gig she flatly declined. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m not that person anymore,\xe2\x80\x9d she explained to Saul. Otto later made his own, far creepier job offer to Carrie \xe2\x80\x94 be his partner in work and life. She agreed to sleep on it.

What did you think of the finale? Got theories about the setting and conceit of Season 6? Grade the episode below and then hit the comments!'

b'Former celebrity couple Rihanna and Drake bumped into each other at a child's birthday party in Los Angles and things got awkward.

In a now deleted Snapchat, RiRi is seen walking around the party, playing with the kids in a ball pit and laughing with friends. Drake was also caught on video hanging out and enjoying the day. The one thing that didn't happen is any interaction between the two \xe2\x80\x93 publicly at least. To be honest, we're not totally surprised. What would YOU do if you ran into an ex at an intimate gathering? Probably the same thing these two did and that is avoid each other at all costs.

RELATED: Drake Admits That He Still Loves Rihanna

The Shade Room posted a few seconds of the footage with the caption, "#PressPlay #Rihanna and #Drake were spotted at a kids party today! They arrived separately, Riri came with her bestie. Drake looks like he was caught off guard ??."

Rihanna and Drake have known each other for a long time and he's professed his love for the songstress more than once. Most notably at the 2016 MTV Video Music Awards when the "One Dance" singer presented Rihanna with the Video Vanguard Award. There was speculation that these two were dating at the time. After the show, they were seen getting dinner alone.

However, things reportedly fizzled out and no one really knows what went down between them. In August, a source told E! News, "Rihanna and Drake are seeing other people at the moment. They are not exclusive anymore. They still love each other, but their schedules have gotten in the way. Anything can change between them though, for better or worse. They are still in each other's lives."

RELATED: Drake Reveals the Most Unexpected Birthday Surprise

Since then, Drake has been romantically linked to India Love and Jennifer Lopez while Rihanna has stayed publicly single. Clearly, things have changed between them considering how little time they spent together at the birthday bash.

No one is quite sure what their status is and if they even acknowledged each other at the gathering. However, we do know that these two are just living their lives exactly like they want at the moment. Both focusing on their careers, friends and family. Because there is so much history between them, we have a feeling these two will be seen hanging out together sooner rather than later. But this birthday party definitely wasn't the place to do that.

RELATED: Here's Why Everyone Thought Drake and Rihanna Were So in Love

Love J-14? Be sure to subscribe to our YouTube channel for fun, exclusive videos with your favorite stars.'

b'Have you ever had an unexpected run in with an old co-worker? In the latest trailer for Marvel's Thor: Ragnarok, Thor finds himself fighting the Hulk in a massive battle arena. The gladiator-esque face off is not exactly a warm reunion between two former Avengers, and it creates a lot of questions. At first Thor seems relieved to run into a familiar face, even if that face is enormous, angry, and green. For a small moment it appears the superhero might be in the clear, but that would be too simple, and the Hulk doesn't seem to recognize his old pal. Instead, the Hulk charges full throttle toward Thor, and right before the two meet in the air the trailer cuts to black.

So, what's going on here? It's clear that something fishy is afoot, or the Hulk wouldn't be trying to clobber a superhero he used to fight evil with. It might have a lot to do with the Grandmaster, a decadently dressed yet rather sinister new villain played by Jeff Goldblum. The Grandmaster seems to be orchestrating this whole fight, and can be seen looking on in disapproval from a skybox above the arena. The big mystery is how the character got the Hulk to turn on a friend. "Oh, come on," Thor says in frustration as the Hulk growls at his friendly approach, and as viewers, we can relate.

Of course, the face off between Thor and the Hulk isn't the only excitement in the new trailer. This is the big reveal of Cate Blanchett's Hela, the Asgardian goddess of death, a character expected to challenge the series' protagonist in a major way. "She plays the worst of the worst. So evil," Mark Ruffalo, who plays the Hulk, described Blanchett's character in an interview with ET Online. "She is going to kill us. It's such a great part she gets to play."

Even without Blanchett's Oscar-winning acting, the film is packed with stars. Tom Hiddleston reprises his role as Loki, who can only be back once more to try and defeat Thor. It also appears Benedict Cumberbatch will make a high-profile appearance as Doctor Strange, and Tessa Thompson (Creed, Westworld) will play the Asgardian superhero Valkyrie. Anthony Hopkins will once again appear as Odin, and Idris Elba returns as Heimdall. On the performance front, this is not the Marvel movie to miss.

Let's just hope that the Hulk recognizes Thor at some point, because it looks like the hero might be in a bit of trouble. It's going to take a lot to defeat Blanchett's Hela, who was a scary enough villain before they introduced that hat with the evil mutant deer horns and thorn studded sword in this trailer. That's not to mention the evil work of Loki and the Grandmaster, who are just two more obstacles in the way of saving Asgard.

The film hits theaters on November 3, 2017, and director Taika Waititi has promised in interviews that even for a superhero movie, it will be truly strange and "out there". This first look trailer definitely supports that claim, but let's just hope we get a few more answers before the movie premieres in the fall.'

b"If you\xe2\x80\x99re looking for some hints as to what tomorrow\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d finale has in store, Allison Williams is not the person to ask. In an interview with TheWrap, the actress known to \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d fans everywhere as Marnie Michaels is going to watch it for the first time on Sunday night with show creator and co-star Lena Dunham.

\xe2\x80\x9cI could have seen it,\xe2\x80\x9d Williams said. \xe2\x80\x9cThey sent it to me, but I just decided I wanted to see it in real time.\xe2\x80\x9d

What we do know is that the final episode of \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d won\xe2\x80\x99t see Hannah, Shoshanna, Marnie and Jessa giving viewers catharsis by seeing them all together as the screen fades to black. Last week\xe2\x80\x99s episode saw the four come to an uneasy reconciliation with each other in the bathroom of Shosh\xe2\x80\x99s apartment, but with all of them coming to accept that they are all better off without each other. Before the four go their separate ways tomorrow night, Williams told us about how the series has changed her as an actress and how she thinks Marnie has changed as a person.

Also Read: 'Girls': 10 Times Hannah Showed Up Wearing the Wrong Thing (Photos)

How did you feel about the decision to have the girls go their separate ways and not see each other in the finale?

I didn\xe2\x80\x99t really know what to make of it from a creator\xe2\x80\x99s point of view because I always try to keep my nose out of what they are doing and I just trust what they\xe2\x80\x99re doing. But from a selfish point of view, I was sad we weren\xe2\x80\x99t all going to be in the same place when the show wrapped because it\xe2\x80\x99s such an emotional moment and it felt strange to know that we were saying goodbye to people who are very close to us before we said goodbye to the show en masse. But I guess it made it more emotionally manageable because the fact that everyone wasn\xe2\x80\x99t done at the same moment meant that everything was more slow and gradual and less of a shock when it was finally over.

Marnie seems to have moments of self-reflection and then backtrack, do you think the scene in the pawn shop this season had a lasting effect in changing how she sees herself?

I love that scene for a million reasons, but especially because Marnie\xe2\x80\x99s ability to view herself has always been hindered by her own point of view on the person she\xe2\x80\x99s talking to. It\xe2\x80\x99s hard for her to take constructive criticism from Hannah, Jessa and Shosh because they\xe2\x80\x99re all peers, so the idea of taking a big lesson from them always felt silly for Marnie. But whenever she faces these cold truths, it comes from unexpected sources.

In this case, she thinks she\xe2\x80\x99s wearing something she thought this man in a pawn shop had never seen before. She\xe2\x80\x99s like \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m not your average pawn shopper, this is an anomalous situation for me.\xe2\x80\x99 And he tells her, \xe2\x80\x98Hey, nobody comes in here when everything\xe2\x80\x99s great. You aren\xe2\x80\x99t an exception to every rule.\xe2\x80\x99 And whenever somebody says that to Marnie, it\xe2\x80\x99s very tough for her to hear, but it\xe2\x80\x99s important. It\xe2\x80\x99s also easier to hear when it\xe2\x80\x99s not coming from someone you watched throw up at a college party. But the phone call she makes to Desi afterwards shows that the talk had an impact on her that other talks don\xe2\x80\x99t always land. Because it came from this stranger and because it came at a very vulnerable moment for her, it does end up altering things for her. It sets the stage for someone who is starting to learn how to operate in the world given how she is.

Also Read: 'Black Panther' Cast Does #GetOutChallenge, Scare the Crap Out of Daniel Kaluuya (Video)

This is a show where the characters hurt each other a lot. Who\xe2\x80\x99s the one person Marnie owes an apology to and who really owes Marnie an apology?

Well\xe2\x80\xa6I sort of think they all owe each other apologies. I think she and everyone she\xe2\x80\x99s ever dated need to apologize to each other. I don\xe2\x80\x99t really know who is at fault, but I do know there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of hurt there. When those relationships are taking form, there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of growing pains and people thrash around and accidentally hurt each other a lot.

Marnie\xe2\x80\x99s no exception to that. Charlie really hurt her. Desi really hurt her by destroying what she thought she wanted and was always going to have and really sending her out into the world in confusion and disarray. But I also don\xe2\x80\x99t know if it should be a full-throated apology because people who have sent her adrift have also triggered some kind of real growth and introspection on her part. I think that tallying of hurt and who is at fault is something that done so much more at the beginning of the show, and at a certain point, there comes a time when they all just call it even.

That\xe2\x80\x99s true especially in this group of friends. If they were to go back and tally how many times they\xe2\x80\x99ve been hurt or they\xe2\x80\x99ve hurt people and start making amends, I think it would quickly become a pretzel and everyone out of exhaustion would agree to make a blanket apology and move on.

Way back in the first season, \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d was criticized in some corners for not being diverse enough. Did your time on \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d increase your interest in telling stories about social issues or in taking roles in projects like \xe2\x80\x9cGet Out\xe2\x80\x9d?

I don\xe2\x80\x99t think \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9cGet Out\xe2\x80\x9d had anything directly to do with each other. I would have played Rose at any time in my career. It was the sort of role I have always kept an eye out for creatively. I do think \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d gave me a sort of critical eye towards the projects that I take on because I knew what it looked like to be a part of something that was created carefully. I wanted to be a part of projects that made deliberate choices and took risks. Safety wasn\xe2\x80\x99t something I was interested in anymore and that negated a lot of the roles that were coming my way.

But as for the criticism of the show, I think being on \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d has taught me to look for roles that were written from a position of intimate knowledge of what they were writing about rather than about a life they didn\xe2\x80\x99t know, which is why Lena didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to try and screw up writing somebody else\xe2\x80\x99s intimate truth. Because of the nature and tone of \xe2\x80\x9cGirls,\xe2\x80\x9d that would be a big whiff. So now I know to look for shows that take that same approach.

Also Read: How Dave Porter Merges the Music of 'Better Call Saul' and 'Breaking Bad' (Audio)

I also think \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d taught me to have the confidence to be patient and wait for the right thing to come along so that when I got the script for \xe2\x80\x9cGet Out\xe2\x80\x9d and then talked to Jordan [Peele], I knew what I had in front of me and I knew that it was worth any risk involved. \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d has given me so many things, but the biggest has been that quiet confidence to make decisions in an industry that pushes you to make quick decisions because of the artificial urgency about people making up their minds.

If, ten years from now, there was a reunion movie or miniseries for \xe2\x80\x9cGirls,\xe2\x80\x9d would you be down for it? And what do you think Marnie\xe2\x80\x99s life would look like a decade from now?

Oh, of course I would be down for a reunion. I already miss working with these people so I would love to reunite. As for Marnie, I think the only way she can have lasting happiness is if she ends up in a relationship with Elijah or somebody like Elijah, where it\xe2\x80\x99s a very modern romance situation where they both get to do what they want to do outside the marriage. But they have a total support system for each other and get to live life with a partner without having to deal with the messiness of intimacy and love that I think is an Achilles\xe2\x80\x99 heel for both Marnie and Elijah. But we\xe2\x80\x99ll see. If a reunion happens I\xe2\x80\x99m sure that \xe2\x80\x94 as has always been the case \xe2\x80\x94 Lena and Jenni [Konner] and Judd [Apatow] will come up with something that is both completely unexpected and something that I never could have thought of.

The series finale of \xe2\x80\x9cGirls\xe2\x80\x9d airs Sunday, April 16 at 10 p.m. on HBO.

This interview has been edited for clarity."

b'After a (most likely) very long time in Jungle Cruise line, Disney World guests were gifted with some unexpected Disney magic: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson crashed their boat!

The star shocked a full crowd of guests -- plus a very smiley cast member! -- by hopping aboard when they least expected it. "Surprise!" Johnson wrote on Instagram. "It was a GREAT day on the river. Learned a lot. For example, it takes approximately 12.6 minutes for all the passengers to get over the shock of me jumping on the boat and thinking I'm a DJ lookalike."

Some of the guests couldn't quite wrap their heads around what was happening: "One passenger even said, 'Oh the real Rock is much smaller than this guy,'" Johnson wrote. "I threw his ass off the boat."

It was announced last week that Johnson has officially signed on to produce and star in a Disney live-action movie based on the classic Adventureland ride. As all Disney aficionados know, the iconic attraction -- which first opened all the way back in 1955 at Disneyland -- is led by skippers who guide the boat along the winding rivers of Asia, Africa and South America.

The skippers are known for their goofy jokes, and thankfully, The Rock knows the importance of their beloved corniness: "Yes, with me as the Cruise Skipper there will be an abundance of puns," he wrote.

"Best part about this surprise research day was knowing how FUN of an experience we're gonna work hard to create for families around the world. That's the part that gets [me] excited the most," he added. "It's the cruise of a lifetime. And trust me, you'll want me as your Skipper. Just don't forget to bring the Skipper's beer."

b'Are Vanderpump Rules couple Brittany Cartwright and Jax Taylor getting their own wedding spin-off on Bravo?

During a new joint interview, the engaged couple let it slip that they are, at the very least, in talks to have their wedding televised on their own series.

When asked about their plans for a bachelor and bachelorette party, Jax let it slip that only one of his bachelor parties (he\xe2\x80\x99s having two) will be on-camera. Brittany then corrected him, stating that it\xe2\x80\x99s not certain yet that their wedding festivities will be televised.

\xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s going to be two bachelor parties,\xe2\x80\x9d said Jax to E! News Daily Pop. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s going to be one for all the guys, we\xe2\x80\x99re going to go on a ski trip in Aspen, I think next month. That one\xe2\x80\x99s going to be off-camera. And then the on-camera one is going to be in Miami.\xe2\x80\x9d

\xe2\x80\x9cWell, we\xe2\x80\x99re hoping on-camera. We don\xe2\x80\x99t know. We haven\xe2\x80\x99t been picked up yet,\xe2\x80\x9d added Brittany.

While the couple has yet to announce their official wedding date, having their bachelor/bachelorette parties in January would point to a winter or spring wedding. And since Vanderpump Rules usually films during the summer months (filming on the latest season started in July), it\xe2\x80\x99s hard to imagine they won\xe2\x80\x99t be getting their own spin-off to document their big day.

Additionally, as most fans of Pump Rules are aware, a wedding spin-off would not make the first for Brittany and Jax as they had another spin-off last year titled Jax And Brittany Take Kentucky.

While Brittany and Jax continue to move forward with plans for their wedding, Brittany, who got engaged to Jax this past June, is opening up about how she moved on from Jax\xe2\x80\x99s fling with Faith Stowers and learned to trust him again.

\xe2\x80\x9cI see him every single day making efforts and he\xe2\x80\x99s completely changed the way he treats me, the way he talks to me, the way he listens to me. Every single thing about our relationship is better,\xe2\x80\x9d Brittany revealed to Us Weekly. \xe2\x80\x9cI know how much he\xe2\x80\x99s wanting the wedding and how much he\xe2\x80\x99s wanting to marry me, how much effort he\xe2\x80\x99s putting into the wedding, just as much as me. I don\xe2\x80\x99t know, whenever you know somebody as well as I know Jax, you can just tell.\xe2\x80\x9d

According to Brittany, she\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cvery big on forgiveness\xe2\x80\x9d but often struggles to forget about Jax\xe2\x80\x99s past infidelity.

\xe2\x80\x9cIt is hard, trust me, and there are still days, sometimes, when you can\xe2\x80\x99t help but think of horrible things from the past,\xe2\x80\x9d Brittany explained. \xe2\x80\x9cBut for the most part, we\xe2\x80\x99ve moved mountains in this relationship. I feel like we\xe2\x80\x99re almost starting over, but we\xe2\x80\x99ve grown so much. He does things before I even ask him now. Even just helping around the house. I can just tell in our everyday lives that he\xe2\x80\x99s changed.\xe2\x80\x9d

Vanderpump Rules season seven premieres on Monday, December 3 at 9 p.m. on Bravo TV.

Photo Credit: Birdie Thompson/AdMedia/ZUMA Wire/Alamy Live News'

b'This article is about the American actor. For other people named Paul Walker, see Paul Walker (disambiguation)

American actor (1973\xe2\x80\x932013)

Paul William Walker IV[3] (September 12, 1973[4] \xe2\x80\x93 November 30, 2013) was an American actor. He is best known for his role as Brian O'Conner in the Fast & Furious franchise.

Walker began his career as a child actor during the 1970s and 1980s, and gained recognition in the early 1990s after appearing in the television soap opera The Young and the Restless. He received praise for his performances in the teen film She's All That and the coming-of-age film Varsity Blues (both 1999), before gaining international fame after starring in The Fast and the Furious (2001).

Walker then starred in the commercially successful road thriller Joy Ride (2001), which led to a reputation as an action star. This continued with his performances in box-office disappointments Into the Blue (2005) and Running Scared (2006). Walker also earned praise in other genres, like in the survival drama Eight Below, and for his portrayal of Hank Hansen the war film Flags of Our Fathers (both 2006). Outside of these, Walker then largely appeared in low budget action films, but starred in the commercially successful heist film Takers (2010).

Walker died on November 30, 2013 at the age of 40 as a passenger in a single-car crash alongside friend and driver Roger Rodas thought to be caused by driving into a gas pipe. Walker's father and daughter filed separate wrongful death lawsuits against Porsche, which resulted in settlements. At the time of his death, Walker had not completed filming Furious 7 (2015), which was completed after rewrites and stand-ins, including his brothers Cody and Caleb, filled in for Walker. The song "See You Again" by Wiz Khalifa and Charlie Puth was commissioned for the film's soundtrack as a tribute to Walker.[5]

Early life

Walker was born on September 12, 1973, in Glendale, California, to American parents with mostly English, as well as German, Swiss, and Irish ancestry.[6] His mother, Cheryl (n\xc3\xa9e Crabtree), was a fashion model,[7] and his father, Paul William Walker III, was a sewer contractor and former amateur boxer, who was a two-time Golden Gloves champion.[8][9] Walker's paternal grandfather, William, had a short-lived boxing career as "Irish" Billy Walker, while another raced factory cars for Ford in the 1960s.[7]

Raised a Mormon,[8] Walker had four younger siblings: Aimee, Ashlie, Caleb, and Cody. He spent the majority of his early life in the Sunland neighborhood of Los Angeles, and graduated from Village Christian School in 1991.[10][11] Walker subsequently attended several community colleges in Southern California, majoring in marine biology.[12]

Career

Walker began a modelling career as a toddler, starring in a television commercial for Pampers at age two. He continued to appear in commercials, most notably for Showbiz Pizza in 1984,[13] before beginning an acting career on television that year, appearing in the teen anthology series CBS Schoolbreak Special. Walker continued to work in television until 1996, across a number of genres; he appeared in two episodes of the fantasy drama Highway to Heaven between 1984 and 1986, and secured his first leading role in 1987, appearing as Jeremy Beatty in the sitcom Throb. He continued to feature on sitcoms in the early 1990s, with guest roles in Charles in Charge, Who's the Boss?, and the shortlived What a Dummy. In 1993, he portrayed Brandon Collins on the soap opera The Young and the Restless; he and co-star Heather Tom, who played Victoria Newman, gained fame, and were nominated for Outstanding Lead Actor and Actress in a Soap Opera at the Youth in Film Awards. Walker's final television role was on Touched by an Angel, although appeared as himself, alongside his sister Ashlie, as contestants on a 1988 episode of the game show I'm Telling!, in which they finished in second place.

Walker began his film career in 1986, appearing mainly in low budget B films. His first role was in the horror comedy Monster in the Closet, and a year later, starred The Retaliator (retroactively subtitled Programmed to Kill), a science fiction film. In 1994, he returned to film, starring in Tammy and the T-Rex, but secured his first feature film role in the comedy Meet the Deedles in 1998; although commercially and critically unsuccessful, it allowed Walker to secure supporting roles in the films Pleasantville (1998), Varsity Blues (1999), She's All That (1999), and The Skulls (2000).[citation needed]

"[Walker] is that guy. As a director, [Walker is] completely supportive of my vision of what the film is. And even better, he's completely game for it." \xe2\x80\x94Wayne Kramer, who directed and cast Walker in Running Scared (2006).[14]

In 2001, Walker's breakthrough role arrived when he starred opposite Vin Diesel in the action film The Fast and the Furious; it was commercially successful, and subsequently launched a media franchise. The film also established Walker as a film star and leading man, as his performance garnered the MTV Movie Award for Best On-Screen Team (shared with Diesel) in 2002. Walker then reprised his role as Brian O'Conner in the 2003 sequel 2 Fast 2 Furious, and also starred in the critically successful thriller Joy Ride (2001). After this, Walker starred mainly in either low-budget or commercially unsuccessful films, notably Timeline (2003) and Into the Blue (2005).

Walker had a supporting role, portraying Hank Hansen Clint Eastwood's war film Flags of Our Fathers (2006), and starred in the survival drama Eight Below, both released in 2006. Eight Below garnered critical acclaim and opened in first place at the box office, grossing over US$20 million during its opening weekend.[15] Walker then starred in the independent film The Lazarus Project, which was released on DVD on October 21, 2008.

Despite initial reluctance, Walker reprised his role as Brian O'Conner after six years, in Fast & Furious. The film became the highest grossing film in the franchise up until that point.[16] He reprised his role in the fifth and sixth installments of the franchise, which were commercially successful, while his performances were praised. Walker was nominated for Choice Movie Actor \xe2\x80\x93 Action at the 2011 Teen Choice Awards for the former, and nominated for Choice Movie: Chemistry (with Diesel and Dwayne Johnson) and won his second MTV Movie Award for Best On-Screen Duo with Diesel for the latter. Walker also starred in the heist film Takers (2010),[17] and returned to modelling in 2011, appearing as the face of fragrance brand Cool Water.[18]

After his death in 2013, four films starring Walker were released; the thriller film Hours (2013), the action film Brick Mansions (2014), itself a remake of the French film District 13 (2004). He also acted as executive producer on the film Pawn Shop Chronicles (2013), while Furious 7, originally slated for release in 2014, was pushed back to recreate Walker's likeness. The filmmakers hired Peter Jackson's Weta Digital visual effects house to complete this,[19] using existing reference materials, Walker's brothers Caleb and Cody, as well as actor John Brotherton, as stand-ins,[20] and outtakes or older footage,[19][21][22] to create an accurate remodel of Walker's face. The film was then released in 2015,[23] and Walker won the award for Choice Movie Actor: Action at the 2015 Teen Choice Awards, and was nominated for Choice Movie: Chemistry (shared with Diesel, Johnson, Michelle Rodriguez, Tyrese Gibson, and Ludacris).

Walker was also set to play Agent 47 in the video game adaptation Hitman: Agent 47, but died before production began.[24] It was later revealed Walker declined the role of Superman in Superman Returns (2006), allegedly due to the Superman curse and the celebrity associated with the role.[25]

Personal life

Walker was raised in a Mormon household, but later became a non-denominational Christian.[26] He lived in Santa Barbara with his dogs.[8][27] He and Rebecca Soteros, a one-time girlfriend, had a daughter named Meadow Rain Walker,[28] who lived with her mother in Hawaii for 13 years and then moved to California to live with Walker in 2011.[29] Her godfather is Vin Diesel, with whom Walker shared a close bond; Diesel gave him the nickname "Pablo",[30] while Walker's mother referred to her son as Diesel's "other half".[31] Walker was also close friends with fellow Fast & Furious co-star Tyrese Gibson.[32] At the time of his death, Walker was dating Jasmine Pilchard-Gosnell.[33]

He held a brown belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu under Ricardo "Franjinha" Miller at Paragon Jiu-Jitsu[34] and was awarded his black belt by Miller posthumously.[35] Walker founded the humanitarian aid nonprofit charity Reach Out Worldwide (ROWW) with financial adviser Roger Rodas in response to the 2010 Haiti earthquake.[36][37] He traveled to a number of disaster-stricken areas to supply aid until his death.

Walker had an interest in marine biology, and joined the board of directors of The Billfish Foundation in 2006.[38] He fulfilled a lifelong dream by starring in the National Geographic Channel series Expedition Great White (retroactively retitled Shark Men), which premiered in June 2010.[39][40] Walker spent 11 days catching and tagging seven great white sharks off the coast of Mexico. The expedition, led by Chris Fischer, founder and CEO of Fischer Productions, and Brett McBride and Michael Domeier of the Marine Conservation Science Institute, took measurements, gathered DNA samples, and fastened real-time satellite tags to the great white sharks, in order to study migratory patterns, especially those associated with mating and birthing, over a five-year period.[41]

A car enthusiast, Walker competed in the Redline Time Attack racing series in which he raced on the AE Performance Team driving a BMW E92 M3. His car was sponsored by Etnies, Brembo Brakes, \xc3\x96hlins, Volk, OS Giken, Hankook, Gintani, and Reach Out Worldwide.[42] Walker had been preparing for an auto show prior to his death.[43] Walker owned Always Evolving, a Valencia high-end vehicle performance shop, where Rodas, a pro-am racer,[44] [45] acted as CEO.[46]

Walker also had a large car collection of about 30 cars, a portion of which he co-owned along with Rodas.[47] The collection included (but is not limited to):[48]

In January 2020, twenty-one vehicles owned by Walker were sold for a combined $2.33 million during spirited bidding at an annual car auction in Arizona.[52]

Death

Site of Walker's death on Hercules Street in Santa Clarita (photo taken on April 5, 2015)

On November 30, 2013, at about 3:30 p.m. PST, Walker, 40, and Roger Rodas, 38, left an event for Walker's charity Reach Out Worldwide for victims of Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda),[53] with Rodas driving[54] his 2005 Porsche Carrera GT. In a 45 mph (72 km/h) speed zone on Hercules Street near Kelly Johnson Parkway in Valencia, Santa Clarita, California, the car crashed into a concrete lamp post and two trees subsequently catching fire to the vehicle.[53][55] Rodas died of multiple trauma while Walker died from the combined effects of trauma and burns. Both of their bodies were burned beyond recognition.[54]

The curve where Walker and Rodas died is a popular spot for drifting cars.[56] No alcohol or other drugs were found in either man's system,[57] and neither mechanical failure nor road conditions appeared to play a role.[58] Police found no evidence of drag racing.[59] The investigation concluded that the car's speed \xe2\x80\x93 between 80 mph (130 km/h) and 93 mph (150 km/h) \xe2\x80\x93 and age of the tires were the primary reasons for the crash.[60]

Grave of Paul Walker at Forest Lawn Hollywood Hills

With Furious 7 in the middle of filming at the time of Walker's death, Universal announced an indeterminate hiatus on the production, citing a desire to speak with his family before determining what to do with the film.[61]

Numerous friends and movie stars posted tributes to Walker on social media.[62] His body was cremated and his ashes were buried in a non-denominational ceremony at Forest Lawn Memorial Park.[63] His life was later chronicled in the documentary I Am Paul Walker, which was released on August 11, 2018.[64]

Legal repercussions

In December 2014, Walker's father filed a wrongful death claim against Rodas' estate seeking the return of or "a proportionate share" of revenue generated by a group of automobiles that were jointly owned by both Walker and Rodas.[65] In September 2015, Walker's daughter filed a wrongful death lawsuit against Porsche, claiming that the Porsche Carrera GT had numerous design defects including a history of instability, and that its seat belt placement can cause harm upon impact.[66] However, Porsche denied any wrongdoing and blamed Walker himself, stating: "The perils, risk, and danger were open and obvious and known to him, and he chose to conduct himself in a manner so as to expose himself to such perils, dangers, and risks, thus assuming all the risks involved in using the vehicle."[67]

In April 2016, U.S. District Court Judge Philip S. Gutierrez ruled in favor of Porsche in a separate lawsuit filed by Rodas' widow Kristine.[68][69] The ruling had no bearing on two other cases against Porsche which have been filed by Walker's father, who is also the executor of the actor's estate, and his daughter.[69] Walker's father and daughter both reached separate out-of-court settlements with Porsche.[70]

b'GULLIVER recently wrote about a pet that suffered a grizzly end after it was not permitted to fly. Spirit Airlines refused to allow a hamster on board as an emotional-support animal and it ended up being flushed down an airport toilet. But sometimes it is more dangerous for an animal to be permitted to ascend to 35,000 feet. Particularly, it seems, if it is flying on United Airlines.

On March 12th, on a flight from Houston to New York, a United Airlines flight attendant knowingly stowed a French bulldog in the overhead compartment, where it died, the family that owned the dog alleges. United quickly apologised to the family for what it called \xe2\x80\x9ca tragic accident that should never have occurred, as pets should never be placed in the overhead bin.\xe2\x80\x9d The airline promised an investigation \xe2\x80\x9cto prevent this from ever happening again.\xe2\x80\x9d

But on United, things like this seem to happen again and again. Last year, a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel died in a United plane\xe2\x80\x99s cargo hold when the flight was delayed on the tarmac\xe2\x80\x94also in Houston\xe2\x80\x94for two hours. Most infamously, a giant rabbit called Simon travelling from London to the Iowa State Fair died on a United flight, possibly freezing to death because it was subjected to cold temperatures or placed next to dry ice. A week of headlines in British tabloids, such as \xe2\x80\x9cNow United\xe2\x80\x99s killing fluffy bunnies!\xe2\x80\x9d, left its reputation in one of its most valuable foreign markets in tatters. And on March 14th, United fessed up to yet another blunder, this time flying a German Shepherd dog from Oregon to Japan instead of its intended destination, Kansas City in Missouri.

In fact, according to data from America\xe2\x80\x99s Department of Transportation, United was far more dangerous to fly on as a doggy or bunny last year than any other airline. Some 18 animals perished on United flights, compared with two each on American, Delta, and Alaska, and zero on all other airlines tracked by the department. Some 13 animals were also reported injured on United flights; no other airline had more than one injury. That comes out to 2.24 incidents for every 10,000 animals transported on United. The second-worst offender, American, had 0.87 incidents per 10,000.

United gained notoriety for its treatment of human passengers last April when a Vietnamese-American passenger, David Dao, was forcibly dragged off an overbooked flight in Chicago. The company\xe2\x80\x99s initial response was possibly the worst bit of crisis-PR in history. As videos of the bloodied man quickly went viral, Oscar Munoz, the carrier\xe2\x80\x99s boss, woodenly apologised for having to \xe2\x80\x9cre-accommodate\xe2\x80\x9d customers and blamed the flyer for not co-operating. After a passenger backlash the company quickly changed its policy and sought to make amends. Yet some aviation analysts reckon that the death of Simon the bunny did much more damage to United\xe2\x80\x99s reputation in Britain than the manhandling of Dr Dao did in America. What is clear is that its brand will continue to suffer if it does not start treating its animal passengers, as well as it human ones, better.'

The conversation isn't productive, as everything the four girls have to say to each other was already said two years previously in the "Beach House" episode, and it ends with Shoshanna declaring she has moved on and no longer wants to be friends with any of them by telling Hannah, Marnie and Jessa that they have held her back from her life and career long enough. Later, when Jessa attempts to make her feel better, Hannah is willing to listen, and they finally make their peace. In one final hurrah, the girls end the night dancing in the apartment, albeit individually. The episode ends as Hannah finally leaves the city and moves into her new home upstate.

AceShowbiz - The very first promo of Rachel Lindsay's season of "The Bachelorette" has arrived online as it's just six weeks away from the premiere. The promo highlights Rachel, the new lady for the upcoming 13th season of the ABC dating competition.

b'Janet Jackson called the police asking for a welfare check on her 1-year-old son, Eissa Al Mana, who was in the care of his father at the time. A watch commander with the Malibu County Sheriff's Office told ET that Jackson called shortly before 10 p.m. on Sunday and asked them to check on Jackson's son, who was staying with his father at the Nobu Hotel. The baby's father is billionaire Wissam Al Mana, Jackson's estranged husband.

Jackson's brother, Randy Jackson, told ET that Janet called 911 after a nanny told her that she was frightened by Wissam's behavior, which she thought was aggressive. Randy said that the nanny was so scared she locked herself in a bathroom so she could call the singer.

Janet Jackson and Wissam Al Mana married in 2012. They had their son on Jan. 2, 2017 and broke up three months later. They said they would be co-parenting their child.

Get Breaking News Delivered to Your Inbox

Jackson announced in 2016 that she was delaying her "Unbreakable" tour to plan a family with her husband. The singer, who was 49 at the time, said, "My husband and I are planning our family, so I'm going to have to delay the tour. Please, if you can, try to understand that it's important that I do this now. I have to rest up; doctor's orders. But I have not forgotten about you."

In November, a source told ET that the couple were committed to parenting together, but had no plans of reconciliation.

"All Janet wants to do is move forward and be the best mother to her son and to be happy," the source added at the time.'

b'Looks like it\xe2\x80\x99s time to say our goodbyes\xe2\x80\x94and transfer Vitamin C\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x9cGraduation (Friends Forever)\xe2\x80\x9d to cassette tape. Though Netflix has yet to officially renew 13 Reasons Why for a third season, if it does, the teen drama\xe2\x80\x99s central character, Hannah Baker, will apparently be absent. Actress Katherine Langford, who plays Hannah, broke the news to Entertainment Weekly on Friday.

\xe2\x80\x9cFor me, we told Hannah\xe2\x80\x99s story so fully in Season 1,\xe2\x80\x9d Langford said, adding that her character was basically in purgatory during Season 2. \xe2\x80\x9cThen being able to officially say goodbye to her\xe2\x80\x94it definitely felt like time. For me, letting Hannah go was in Season 1; Season 2 was for Clay to let her go.\xe2\x80\x9d Representatives for Netflix declined to comment on the status of the show\xe2\x80\x99s renewal or cancellation, but confirmed that Langford\xe2\x80\x99s involvement with the series will officially end with Season 2.

Langford made her on-screen debut in 13 Reasons Why, so the series will always be special to her, she said. Looking forward, however, Langford said she\xe2\x80\x99s also excited about what\xe2\x80\x99s yet to come: \xe2\x80\x9cEven though the show is so huge, and I\xe2\x80\x99m so thankful to have had the opportunity to play Hannah, it still is just one thing that I\xe2\x80\x99ve done, and since then I feel very grateful to have been a part of Love, Simon, and I have another film, Spontaneous. But I think ultimately, I feel like playing Hannah was such a small part of me that was magnified, and I\xe2\x80\x99m just really excited to, over the next few months or years, show the rest of me.\xe2\x80\x9d

The series can certainly survive without Hannah, considering she\xe2\x80\x99s been dead since Season 1. Her constant presence was one of the lower points of Season 2, if only because it felt forced; the show\xe2\x80\x99s plot also ground to a halt every time Clay began to converse with her newly present ghost.

Still, her loss will alter the alchemy of the series, stripping it of the mysterious storytelling element that differentiated the first season\xe2\x80\x94and some of the second. Season 1 was structured around a series of tapes that revealed the exact circumstances that led Hannah, already dead, to commit suicide. In Season 2, fans learned about other aspects of Hannah\xe2\x80\x99s life that retrospectively shifted her story into a new light. With that layer of mystery gone, what\xe2\x80\x99s left will likely be a far more standard teen drama\xe2\x80\x94not necessarily a bad thing, but almost certainly a factor Netflix will consider as it weighs whether to renew the series. Given that cliffhanger ending in the finale, however, a junior year for 13 Reasons Why still seems likely.'

b'Kate Beckinsale Biography

The beautiful British actress Kate Beckinsale was born Kathrin Romary Beckinsale. She has not only managed to survive but has carved a niche for herself in the cold and cruel world of Hollywood showbiz. She is in the midst of a constantly growing career graph and is highly acknowledged. She became an iconic action star after the release of her cult classic Underworld in 2003 and has worked in many action movies since. She won the Best Actress Award at Sitges \xe2\x80\x93 Catalonian International Film Festival in 1997 for her film Shooting Fish. In 1999 she won the British Supporting Actress of the Year at London Critics Circle Film Awards for the movie The Last Days of Disco and in 2012 she won the Jean-Claude Gahd Dam at Spike Guy\xe2\x80\x99s Choice Awards for her movie Underworld: Awakening.

Early life



Kathrin Romary Beckinsale was born in London, England. She is the only child of actor Richard Beckinsale and actress Judy Loe. Her father was of one-quarter Burmese descent. She made her first television appearance at the age of four, in an episode of This is Your Life dedicated to her father. When she was five years old, her 31-year-old father died suddenly of a heart attack. Beckinsale was deeply traumatised by the loss and "started expecting bad things to happen". While she has seen her father "more on television than I have in life", "there are certainly enough memories for me not to feel that it's somebody I didn't know."Her widowed mother moved in with director Roy Battersby when Beckinsale was nine and she was brought up alongside his four sons and daughter. She has a close relationship with her step-father: "I couldn't have knitted a better one ... He wasn't pushy, he let me come to him." She has a paternal half-sister, actress Samantha Beckinsale, but they have not had regular contact. Beckinsale was educated at the fee-paying Godolphin and Latymer School in Hammersmith, West London and was involved with the Orange Tree Youth Theatre. She was a two-time winner of the WH Smith Young Writers Award for both fiction and poetry. She has described herself as a "late bloomer": "All of my friends were kissing boys and drinking cider way before me. I found it really depressing that we weren't making camp fires and everyone was doing grown-up stuff." "I loathed being a teenager."She had a nervous breakdown and developed anorexia at the age of 15 and underwent Freudian psychoanalysis for four years



Acting career

Early acting roles (1991\xe2\x80\x931997)



Beckinsale decided at a young age that she wanted to be an actress: "I grew up immersed in film. My family were in the business. I quickly realised that my parents seemed to have much more fun in their work than any of my friends\xe2\x80\x99 parents." She was inspired by the performances of Jeanne Moreau.She made her television debut in 1991 with a small part in an ITV adaptation of P. D. James\xe2\x80\x99 Devices and Desires. Also that year, she appeared as a young woman engaging in a forbidden affair with a Nazi officer in the Hallmark film One Against The Wind. In 1992 she starred alongside Christopher Eccleston in Rachel\xe2\x80\x99s Dream, a 30\xe2\x80\x91minute Channel 4 short and in 1993, she appeared in the pilot of the ITV detective series, Anna Lee, starring Imogen Stubbs.In 1993, Beckinsale landed the role of Hero in Kenneth Branagh's big-screen adaptation of Much Ado About Nothing. It was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during a summer holiday from Oxford University.She attended the film's Cannes Film Festival premiere and later remembered it as an overwhelming experience.



Move to Hollywood (1998\xe2\x80\x932002)



At this point in her career, Beckinsale began to seek work in the United States, something she has said wasn't "a conscious decision...My boyfriend was in a play on Broadway so that's why we ended up in New York, and my auditions happened to be for American films". She starred opposite Chlo Sevigny in 1998's The Last Days of Disco. The Whit Stillman film focused on a group of Ivy League graduates socialising in the Manhattan disco scene of the early 1980s. Beckinsale's attempt at an American accent was widely praised. Kenneth Turan of the Los Angeles Times felt her role as the bossy Charlotte was "beautifully played".



Focus on small-scale drama (2007\xe2\x80\x932009)



Beckinsale then made a return to smaller-scale projects: "My experience is that I sort of stepped away from the independent movies and did a couple of big movies. But that's not necessarily how it's perceived by everybody else, which I do understand.""I enjoy an action movie as much as the next person it\xe2\x80\x99s not something that I would like to do solely." She explained that she had originally decided to appear in Underworld because she felt typecast in classical roles \xe2\x80\x94 it was "assumed that I use a chamber pot and wear bloomers"\xe2\x80\x93 but that her action career "kind of took off a little too much". In 2007, Beckinsale starred opposite Sam Rockwell in the independent drama Snow Angels, based on the novel by Stewart O'Nan. The harrowing film, in which she played an overwhelmed single mother, put Beckinsale "in kind of a tough place".



Personal life

Relationships



Beckinsale had an eight-year relationship with actor Michael Sheen from 1995 until 2003. They met when cast in a touring production of The Seagull in early 1995 and moved in together shortly afterwards. She has said it was "love at first sight"and that he saved her from "a hospital for the criminally insane". In 1997, they appeared in a radio production of Romeo and Juliet.Their daughter, Lily Mo Sheen, was born in London in 1999. The actress has said she was "embarrassed" that Sheen never proposed but felt as though she were married: "If you keep a library book out long enough, you feel it's yours."



Their relationship ended in early 2003, after the filming of Underworld.Beckinsale had persuaded director Len Wiseman to cast Sheen in the film, but, while on set, she and Wiseman (who was married) began a relationship. All parties, aside from Wiseman's first wife,have maintained that there was no infidelity.Wiseman married Beckinsale on May 9, 2004 in Bel-Air, California. They live in Los Angeles. Beckinsale and Wiseman both remain friends with Sheen.'

b'Ask and you shall receive: After a swarm of messages from fans demanding it, HBO announced Big Little Lies is officially returning for a second season. It makes total sense why the network wants to continue this franchise. For one, people loved it: The season-one finale brought in a whopping 1.9 million viewers, which is huge for premium cable. It was also a critical favorite, scoring big at both the Emmy and Golden Globe awards. Will lightning strike twice, though? Based on what HBO has released about season two, it seems like yes. The brand has all the ingredients to make a phenomenal second season (including Meryl Streep).

Until then, here's everything we know about Big Little Lies season two. Fair warning: Season one spoilers ahead!

It will premiere on June, 9 2019. Let the countdown begin.

The first full-length trailer looks amazing. It dropped on Friday, May 10. Check it out for yourself, below:

And here's the other teaser for the season. Released on April 14.

All of the original cast is returning. Originally HBO had confirmed only Reese Witherspoon and Nicole Kidman. In a press release issued later, the network said most of season one's cast is expected to return. All of the original actresses are said to be receiving significant pay bumps, as well.

"We all said goodbye at the end, but we became very close and had such a good time doing it, and the desire to spend more time together was a huge part of it," Kidman said at the February TCA panel. "But there was an enormous demand from the audience. I\xe2\x80\x99ve never been in something that reached so far, and that was such a compelling idea in terms of putting it together again.\xe2\x80\x9d

David E. Kelley, the screenwriter behind season one, is coming back\xe2\x80\x94and he'll write all seven scripts for season two. "Going back to last season, we didn\xe2\x80\x99t really close the chapter," Kelley said at the TCA panel. "It ended on an open note. What will happen to these relationships, friendships, marriage? Everybody up here can get jobs\xe2\x80\x94we didn\xe2\x80\x99t want to do this unless we could at least have a fair shot of living up to the bar that we had set in year one. We met and talked about what the stories were and were very candid about what was viable and which stories were not good enough. We didn\xe2\x80\x99t agree to set sail until we agreed this was storytelling we felt passionate about.\xe2\x80\x9d'

b'Last-minute nerves! Kendall Jenner worries that her clothing line might get negative reviews in this Sunday\xe2\x80\x99s episode of Keeping Up With the Kardashians.

In the clip, the 21-year-old supermodel finds out that Vogue wants to review her and her sister Kylie Jenner\xe2\x80\x99s fashion line, Kendall + Kylie. Kylie, 19, enters the room to find Kendall nervously flipping through the rack and asks what\xe2\x80\x99s going on.

\xe2\x80\x9cI just wanted to go over it. Make sure we like every little thing. If there\xe2\x80\x99s something we want to take out,\xe2\x80\x9d Kendall said of the collection. \xe2\x80\x9cF\xe2\x80\x93k! I don\xe2\x80\x99t know why I\xe2\x80\x99m so nervous.\xe2\x80\x9d

The former Vogue cover girl explains in a confessional that she doesn\xe2\x80\x99t want a bad review to ruin her credibility. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m really proud of the line, but I\xe2\x80\x99ve worked really hard to be taken seriously and recognized in Vogue and in the fashion world,\xe2\x80\x9d she admits. \xe2\x80\x9cIf this doesn\xe2\x80\x99t go as well as we hope, it might tarnish some things in the modeling world, so it\xe2\x80\x99s even more frightening.\xe2\x80\x9d

When Kylie asks if she\xe2\x80\x99s having second thoughts about releasing the line, Kendall says she\xe2\x80\x99s freaking out. \xe2\x80\x9cEveryone wants an excuse to talk s\xe2\x80\x93t, and I don\xe2\x80\x99t want this to be that,\xe2\x80\x9d Kendall says.

The lip kit maven reassures her older sister that everything will be fine. \xe2\x80\x9cI think it\xe2\x80\x99s cute. I feel confident about it,\xe2\x80\x9d Kylie says while tearing up. \xe2\x80\x9cWe worked so hard on this. There\xe2\x80\x99s so many pieces, like, there\xe2\x80\x99s no way they\xe2\x80\x99re not going to love it.\xe2\x80\x9d

Keeping Up With the Kardashians airs on E! Sundays at 9 p.m. ET.'

b"Hollywood star Eddie Murphy is \xe2\x80\x98not interested\xe2\x80\x99 in seeing his 10-year-old daughter Angel, the child he has with America\xe2\x80\x99s Got Talent star Mel B, a Los Angeles court was told Wednesday.

The Spice Girl\xe2\x80\x99s ex-husband Stephen Belafonte - who helped raise Angel during his 10-year marriage to Mel - is trying to persuade a judge to grant him step-parent visitation with the child, whom, he says, \xe2\x80\x98has called me dad since she started to talk.\xe2\x80\x99

Mel, 42 - who showed up at LA Superior Court today wearing a green silk shirt, flowered pants, yellow spike heels and a new frizzy hairdo - is vehemently opposing his efforts, refusing to let him see her daughter.

But Belafonte\xe2\x80\x99s lawyer, Grace Jamra, said that she had been trying to reach Murphy, Angel\xe2\x80\x99s biological dad, to discuss Belafonte\xe2\x80\x99s step-parent request but to no avail.

Mel B was in court Wednesday (pictured) against her ex husband Stephen Belafonte who is seeking step-parents rights to see the Angel, 10, who is Eddie Murphy's daughter with Mel

Eddie Murphy said he has never had a relationship with Angel (right with Mel and younger sister Madison Belafonte) and is simply not interested in beginning one now

Belafonte (pictured outside court in December) says Angel has called him 'dad' since she has been able to speak and he raised her as his own, and Mel has cut contact

Mel B seemed somber as she walked out of court Wednesday

Eddie Murphy was pictured leaving The Laugh Factory in 2006 with then girlfriend Scary Spice Melanie Brown (Mel B) after a night out in Hollywood

As part of their divorce settlement, Mel - real name Melanie Brown - and Belafonte were to split the proceeds of their former marital home in LA, worth an estimated $6-7 million. Pictured left: Mel with Angel. Right: Angel in LA

Jamra said she was told by his lawyers that Murphy is simply \xe2\x80\x98not interested.\xe2\x80\x99

\xe2\x80\x98Mr Murphy has had no contact with the child,\xe2\x80\x99 she told the court.

Jamra added that she had tried to serve Murphy with legal papers, but \xe2\x80\x98Mr. Murphy is avoiding service.\xe2\x80\x99

As part of their divorce settlement, Mel - real name Melanie Brown - and Belafonte were to split the proceeds of their former marital home in LA, worth an estimated $6-7 million.

Belafonte - who also showed up Wednesday, wearing a dark suit - has complained to the court that his ex-wife has been dragging her feet in paying her share of the $20,000 needed to repair the home and get it in shape to sell.

Judge Mark Juhas ordered Mel to pay $10,000 to match the $10,000 Belafonte has already shelled out toward the house repairs

Belafonte and Mel divorced last December after a bitter, seven-month battle in which lurid tales of kinky sex, drug and alcohol abuse and allegations of domestic violence made headlines.

He was given joint-custody of his daughter with Mel, six-year-old Madison, and he went back to court to try to win step-parent rights to visit Angel.

But Mel has consistently blocked his efforts to spend time with Angel, calling him in court papers a \xe2\x80\x98bad man\xe2\x80\x99 and accusing him of being violent and abusive during their 10-year marriage.

Last week she even charged in a new court filing that he had made Mel's daughters, including his six-year-old, Madison, watch videos of ISIS beheadings.

Belafonte, 42, filed his own court response with a strong denial, calling Mel's accusation \xe2\x80\x98outlandish and alarming\xe2\x80\x99 and adding: \xe2\x80\x98I have never and would never show ISIS videos to our children.\xe2\x80\x99

Belafonte - who claims that Mel has been violating his joint-custody of Madison (he gets her on Wednesday nights and alternate weekends) - says Brown refuses to let him see Angel.

\xe2\x80\x98I strongly believe that Brown\xe2\x80\x99s abrupt decision to cut off all ties between Angel and I has been emotionally traumatizing and detrimental to Angel\xe2\x80\x99s mental health and well being,\xe2\x80\x99 he added in legal papers.

Belafonte says that he gave his daughter Madison a teddy bear and other toys to give to Angel.

Eddie, who has been in a relationship with Paige Butcher (pictured) since 2012, has said he does not want to have a relationship with his 10-year-old daughter Angel

Happier times: Mel B and husband Stephen Belafonte attend the Lacoste VIP Lounge on day six of the ATP World Finals 2014 at 02 Arena on November 14, 2014

But \xe2\x80\x98Madison later informed me that Brown threw out the toys before they could even get to Angel'.

The couple\xe2\x80\x99s marriage fell apart in March last year when Brown filed for divorce, citing irreconcilable differences, and she took out a domestic violence restraining order against Belafonte, accusing him of years of abuse against her, embezzling $10 million of her money and keeping her drugged during much of their marriage.

She also took out a civil harassment restraining order against the couple\xe2\x80\x99s beautiful blonde nanny Lorraine Gilles whom she branded a \xe2\x80\x98home wrecker\xe2\x80\x99 and \xe2\x80\x98prostitute\xe2\x80\x99 she claimed had an affair with Belafonte and conspired with him against her by threatening to release embarrassing sex videos of Mel.

Over the following seven months intimate details were revealed about the couple\xe2\x80\x99s sex life during their marriage, including three-ways with German-born Gilles who claimed to have had a seven-year sexual relationship with the British singer.

Belafonte who accused his estranged wife of being addicted to cocaine and alcohol during their marriage - and Gilles, 26 - repeatedly denied Mel's charges against them and fought the restraining orders through 20-plus court hearings till, at last, the case was set to go to trial in November 2017. It was halted at the last minute after the former couple came to a private settlement.

The divorce became final last December 15 with Mel agreeing to pay Belafonte $15,000 a month in spousal support until December 2020.

When Judge Juhas set May 29 as the date of a settlement conference where the former couple can try to reach an agreement, Mel showed the frostiness she still has toward Belafonte by asking the judge, \xe2\x80\x98Do I have to be in the same room as him, like a small room?\xe2\x80\x99 When the judge told her that the settlement conference would be in a large courtroom, she looked relieved and said, \xe2\x80\x98That\xe2\x80\x99s OK\xe2\x80\x99.

Judge Juhas also ordered Mel to give a three-hour deposition to Belafonte\xe2\x80\x99s lawyers on April 23."

b'Tyler Hoechlin returning as Superman for crossover, Lois Lane to appear

DC has announced that Tyler Hoechlin (Teen Wolf, Supergirl) will be returning to The CW as Superman in this year\xe2\x80\x99s annual Arrowverse superhero crossover event. The Man of Steel will also be joined by Lois Lane, marking the power couple\xe2\x80\x99s DCTV crossover debut.

Hoechlin made his first appearance as Clark Kent in season two of Supergirl as Kara Danvers legendary cousin. After being featured in four episodes of the series, Hoechlin will put back on his cape as we wait to see who will be cast to play Lois Lane.

The CW recently set the dates for the annual crossover, with this year\xe2\x80\x99s storyline heading to Gotham City, a place previously off-limits to The CW. The crossover will start with The Flash on Sunday, December 9. Arrow will continue the story on Monday, December 10, before it all comes to an end in Supergirl on Tuesday, December 11. DC\xe2\x80\x99s Legends of Tomorrow is sitting out of this year\xe2\x80\x99s event, and Black Lightning has yet to establish any firm links with the Arrowverse.

Season 3 saw Supergirl stop Reign and the other Worldkillers\xe2\x80\x99 threat to humanity and our planet, and in the process, Kara was shocked to find her mother Alura alive and living in a salvaged Argo City that survived the destruction of Krypton. Reconnecting with her past caused Kara to realize that her true home is now here on Earth, where big changes are taking place for her and all of her friends in National City \xe2\x80\x93 and also, it appears, for a doppelganger in Russia! Season four promises to be full of surprises, action, adventure and lots of big revelations for Supergirl, Alex, James, J\xe2\x80\x99onn, Lena and Brainy.

Supergirl stars Melissa Benoist as Kara Danvers/Supergirl, Mehcad Brooks as James Olsen, Chyler Leigh as Alex Danvers, Jeremy Jordan as Winslow \xe2\x80\x98Winn\xe2\x80\x99 Schott, Katie McGrath as Lena Luthor, Jess Rath as Brainiac 5, and David Harewood as Hank Henshaw/J\xe2\x80\x99onn J\xe2\x80\x99onnz. New to the cast for the fourth season is Sam Witwer as hero Agent Liberty.

Based on the DC characters created by Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster, the series is executive produced by Greg Berlanti, Sarah Schechter, Robert Rovner and Jessica Queller. Supergirl is produced by Berlanti Productions in association with Warner Bros. Television.

Supergirl season four will premiere on The CW on its new night, Sunday, October 14, at 8:00 p.m.

Are you excited for Hoechlin to return as Superman? Who do you want to see play Lois Lane? Let us know what you think in the comments!'

b"He has been spotted out and about with Katy Perry on a frequent basis, ever since it was confirmed that their romance was back on in April.

And Orlando Bloom, 41, appears to be hinting things have become particularly serious between himself and the 33-year-old singer, as he revealed to fans on Wednesday that he has a strong desire to become a father again.

The actor, who shares seven-year-old son Flynn with ex-wife Miranda Kerr, made the revelation when a fan using Instagram's new Ask Me Anything feature enquired if he wanted more offspring, to which he responded: 'Yes, I love being a dad.'

Getting serious: Orlando Bloom has hinted things could be getting very serious between him and on-again girlfriend Katy Perry. Pictured together in June 2018

The British heartthrob's revelation on social media comes as it was reported that California-born Fireworks singer Katy wants to move to London to be closer to him.

Though they already both have homes in Los Angeles - hers is in Hollywood while his is in Malibu - the two have been spending time together in England recently.

And UsWeekly has quoted sources as saying that they look even happier whenever they're together in the UK.

Dad: The 41-year-old star revealed that he wants to have more children during a chat with fans

Many questions: The actor chatted with his fans via Instagram's new Ask Me Anything feature

Read all about it: He covered a variety of topics during his chat, including his favourite books

Last month, Katy was spotted in the English capital grabbing dinner with her actor beau after she attended his West End play, Killer Joe.

The I Kissed A Girl singer was between legs of her Witness world tour and jetted off to the United Kingdom to visit her Lord Of The Rings star lover.

Effort: All of that seems to be in the past now, however, as the Roar singer has been seen frequently jetting off to London since they got back together; seen in NYC in 2016

The source went on to add that other diners 'noticed she was so in love with him by the way she looked at him... Orlando was cracking her up.'

Since rekindling their romance, the Roar singer has been seen frequently jetting off to London to spend time with the screen star."

b'Mike "Sugar Bear" Thompson is speaking up against the abuse allegations made by his ex, Mama June Shannon.

On Tuesday, Mama June was a guest on The Wendy Williams Show, where she claimed Sugar Bear was "very emotionally and physically" abusive to her during their "many, many years" together. She also alleged that he does not have a relationship with their 11-year-old daughter, Alana "Honey Boo Boo" Thompson, and claims he injured 17-year-old Lauryn "Pumpkin" Shannon.

"Everything I've said is the truth," he added. "I'm just tired of being put down for it. June is saying these things because she's pissed at me. I never hurt any kid."

ET also spoke to Honey Boo Boo, who echoed her mother's words about her not having a relationship with her father, and spoke on the aforementioned comments about her weight.

"He calls me every once in a blue moon, so if there's a blue moon outside, he's going to call me," she explained.
