b'On December 26, 1996, a little more than a year after O.J. Simpson was acquitted of killing his ex-wife Nicole and her friend Ron Goldman, six-year-old beauty queen JonBenet Ramsey was found murdered in the basement of her family\xe2\x80\x99s home in Boulder, Colorado. By that point, Dateline NBC correspondent Josh Mankiewicz says, \xe2\x80\x9cthe criminal justice system had become, for some people, a spectator sport, and the machinery that had ramped up under O. J. went straight to Boulder.\xe2\x80\x9d

Twenty years later, in a culture still jonesing for true-crime narratives (The Jinx, Mommy Dead and Dearest), the Ramsey murder has undergone a second round of scrutiny, once again in tandem with the Simpson case. If the first half of 2016 belonged to ESPN\xe2\x80\x99s Oscar-winning documentary, O. J.: Made in America, and FX\xe2\x80\x99s dramatic miniseries The People v. O. J. Simpson, the second saw six projects that revisited the still-unsolved Ramsey case\xe2\x80\x94including a three-part Dr. Phil special featuring JonBenet\xe2\x80\x99s brother, Burke Ramsey, and Mankiewicz\xe2\x80\x99s investigative Dateline report, \xe2\x80\x9cWho Killed JonBenet?\xe2\x80\x9d

A seventh project, the documentary Casting JonBenet, premiered on Netflix and in select theaters in late April. Directed by Kitty Green, a 32-year-old from Melbourne, Australia, it is a fascinating coda to its predecessors. If any of the projects wins awards, it\xe2\x80\x99ll be this one.

\xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s weirder than Twin Peaks in a lot of ways,\xe2\x80\x9d Green says of the case, which does bear some parallels to the David Lynch TV series. Green took a highly unconventional approach to the story, interviewing more than 200 Coloradans who auditioned, via an open casting call, to play members of the Ramsey family and others involved in the saga. Those who end up on-screen inevitably interpret the whodunit theories through their own experiences and traumas, revealing the dark secrets behind picturesque small-town life. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s always somebody you know,\xe2\x80\x9d says one woman auditioning for the part of Patsy Ramsey, JonBenet\xe2\x80\x99s mother, before revealing that a man she knew attempted to molest her when she was six. Another auditioner, trying out for a cop role, reveals that he is a sex educator and ends up demonstrating S&M floggers on camera.

\xe2\x80\x9cAmericans love to talk,\xe2\x80\x9d says Green, who, while remaining respectful of her subjects, has some fun with our national need to overshare. \xe2\x80\x9cEveryone let their guard down and were willing to be vulnerable with me,\xe2\x80\x9d she says, adding, \xe2\x80\x9cThere is no way I could have made that film in Australia.\xe2\x80\x9d'

b"Getting counseling on a television reality show isn't everyone's idea of therapy.

But Kendra Wilkinson says she wished she could have had more time on WEtv's Marriage Boot Camp: Family Edition with her estranged mother Patti.

'It's so easy to look around and see the cameras and be like, 'This is a TV show, a train wreck TV show that I'm a part of. This ain't therapy,' and then it proves you wrong,' Hugh Hefner's ex told E! News.

'You're forced to believe in it,' the 31-year-old former Playmate explained. 'You're forced to give because you're so drained. If you're here just do it.'

On camera counseling: Kendra Wilkinson told E! Wednesday that reality show Marriage Boot Camp was good therapy for her and her estranged mother

Kendra, who has been married for eight year to former NFL pro Hank Baskett, cut off all contact with her mother in 2015 after accusing her of leaking information to the press.

She even refused to tell her mother she was pregnant with her second child out of fear Patti would tell the tabloids.

Acknowledging that money was an incentive for taking part in the reality show, she told E!: 'I just decided to go in there and stick it through because I really closed the door on my mom. I was prepared to go through it and not say one word to her. That doesn't really work out that way.'

She's a regular: The former Playmate, 31, cut off contact with her mom Patti in 2015. The two were forced to confront their issues on the reality show, that also helped Kendra with her marriage in 2015

'The hardest part is knowing you only have two weeks to get what you need back. To get closure in your life,' Kendra said

Kendra had previously appeared on Marriage Boot Camp with hubby Hank in 2015 after reports he had had an affair with a transgender model while she was pregnant.

She said the show had taught her to pick apart 'the most painful thing you've ever experienced and experiment how to forgive it.'"

b'If Sean Penn could offer up one piece of universal advice, it would probably be \xe2\x80\x98Don\xe2\x80\x99t believe everything you read.\xe2\x80\x99

If you assumed this was in reference to how he\xe2\x80\x99s portrayed in the press, you\xe2\x80\x99d be partially correct. It\xe2\x80\x99s more than that though: the award-winning humanitarian and two-time Oscar-winning actor would also be alluding to the public perception of Haiti, a place he has personally invested his time and finances in, and his attention to, for the past six years. After an earthquake ravaged the Caribbean country in 2010, he founded J/P Haitian Relief Organization (HRO), which began as an emergency relief organization of 32 Americans. It has since expanded to a rank of nearly 200\xe2\x80\x94most of whom are Haitian\xe2\x80\x94with a goal of turning over the previously-built medical, educational and community development centers entirely to the Haitian people. Despite all the progress he\xe2\x80\x99s made, the country is far from escaping its reputation as the poorest country in the western hemisphere, but Penn won\xe2\x80\x99t bow out until the job is done. \xe2\x80\x9cThere was a commitment that we made to the country, and it\xe2\x80\x99s just unfinished business, I suppose. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re still here.\xe2\x80\x9d

There\xe2\x80\x99s no doubt that the 56-year-old icon has done\xe2\x80\x94and continues to do\xe2\x80\x94more than his part to help Haiti escape its vicious cycle of poverty and insecurity. However, the country\xe2\x80\x99s \xe2\x80\x98Open for Business\xe2\x80\x99 slogan isn\xe2\x80\x99t even close to being true right now, especially in the wake of the damage Hurricane Matthew inflicted upon the country\xe2\x80\x99s southern region, destroying several villages and killing more than 800 people. Penn, however, places blame on more than Mother Nature. \xe2\x80\x9c[Haiti] has been very close to staying open for business, and then it gets thrown back for two main reasons.\xe2\x80\x9d He notes that one is because the country\xe2\x80\x99s leaders and its wealthy residents seem to be overinvested in the comfort zone of a system that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t allow for export, and demands that the country \xe2\x80\x9cbe a slave to the poor.\xe2\x80\x9d The other, more pressing problem in his eyes is the media: \xe2\x80\x9c[Members of the press have] been so incredibly irresponsible and uninformed in their reporting on Haiti, politically,\xe2\x80\x9d he says, adding, \xe2\x80\x9cI think that a four-day visit is a lot more damaging than no visit at all. There\xe2\x80\x99s kind of an impatience with understanding culturally [and politically] what goes on.\xe2\x80\x9d

Though he isn\xe2\x80\x99t a fan of media in general, he\xe2\x80\x99s quick to praise Anthony Bourdain\xe2\x80\x99s early coverage of the nation on his food and travel reality show, No Reservations. The celebrity chef and TV personality turned what could have been a frothy segment on Haiti\xe2\x80\x99s cuisine and culture into an insightful look at its 2011 climate. Penn filmed a small segment for the series and, after it aired, took himself out for a meal in the nation\xe2\x80\x99s capital, Port-au-Prince. \xe2\x80\x9cI remember going into a restaurant that night and people had seen [the piece]. Everyone was saying, \xe2\x80\x98Finally, somebody got Haiti,\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d he recalls.

Somebody besides him, that is to say. Because what started off for Penn as a two-week trip to \xe2\x80\x9clend a hand\xe2\x80\x9d distributing pain medications like morphine and ketamine to trauma centers turned into a nine-month pilgrimage. Bottom line: he wanted to do some good, and he wanted to be close enough to his daughter Dylan and son Hopper that, if something serious happened back home in Los Angeles, he\xe2\x80\x99d be a quick plane ride away from the US. \xe2\x80\x9cNow, some might say, \xe2\x80\x98Well, why not stick to the United States [if you want to do some good]?\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d he notes. \xe2\x80\x9cIt really just happened this way: once I got to Haiti, like so many other people, I fell in love with it\xe2\x80\x94the people there, the possibilities that is has.\xe2\x80\x9d

He also believes that the United States has a \xe2\x80\x9csacred debt\xe2\x80\x9d to the Haitians in order to correct some of the mistakes it made in the past\xe2\x80\x94a debt owed, if you will\xe2\x80\x94and that it really pays to get the country out of trouble for the first time and help provide secure footing. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s not going to be an overnight process\xe2\x80\x94nobody ever said it would be\xe2\x80\x94but I think that the people are ready to take care of themselves, and that\xe2\x80\x99s when things change.\xe2\x80\x9d

And change it will be a-coming in a very, very big way. In August, Penn and J/P HRO announced their participation in Haiti Takes Root, an ambitious, long-term commitment from both the Haitian and French governments, as well as billionaire Sean Parker via The Parker Foundation. The ten-year, $300 million initiative seeks to repair the country from within by increasing technical expertise and strengthening environmental governance. The goal is to improve government relations and both ecotourism and environmental legislation. Needless to say, it\xe2\x80\x99s a pretty ambitious undertaking, but Penn and his pals are up to the challenge.

\xe2\x80\x9cA powerful consortium of commitments have been made from the French government, to the Haitian government, to many international NGOs, and of course the Parker Foundation,\xe2\x80\x9d he says of the collaboration. \xe2\x80\x9c[Sean Parker] signed on as the piper. He\xe2\x80\x99s an extremely generous philanthropist and I knock wood that things are going well for him [in his other philanthropic ventures, including The Parker Institute for Cancer Immunotherapy] because he\xe2\x80\x99s really bold. He is a disrupter and I love him.\xe2\x80\x9d

One might say that Penn is somewhat of a disrupter himself\xe2\x80\x94though, quite humbly, he dismisses the praise. \xe2\x80\x9c[The initiative] hasn\xe2\x80\x99t seemed to be disruptive yet, but I think we\xe2\x80\x99ve gotten people coming on board who have mutual concerns and a lot of support [for the cause].\xe2\x80\x9d He pauses a beat, and seems to be almost speaking to himself when he says, \xe2\x80\x9cThe only thing is that we\xe2\x80\x99ve got to get it right.\xe2\x80\x9d

Economically, the country is in severe need of agro-reforestation but, luckily, Penn is up for the challenge. He\xe2\x80\x99s got big plans for Haiti\xe2\x80\x94including a complete restructure of the country\xe2\x80\x99s landscape to enhance its value as an ecotourism destination. That said, he realizes that they need to keep it simple to start with. \xe2\x80\x9cYou can\xe2\x80\x99t forget to have exportable produce, but you have to have good roads first because, if you don\xe2\x80\x99t, the produce is going to get bruised all the way to the market. There are a lot of pieces to this puzzle and it\xe2\x80\x99s going to take a lot of investment.\xe2\x80\x9d He adds, \xe2\x80\x9cIf I\xe2\x80\x99m talking to the people of the United States of America, [I\xe2\x80\x99d say that] we have made a tremendous investment and we have to finish it. It\xe2\x80\x99s a call to humanity, it\xe2\x80\x99s a call on behalf of our neighbor, to pick a country up out of poverty and put it [in a position to feel] pride. That\xe2\x80\x99s the call to action.\xe2\x80\x9d

REBELING AGAINST ADVICE + PARTY PLANNING FOR A CAUSE

The best advice Sean Penn could offer, for the record, isn\xe2\x80\x99t the same thing as the best advice he\xe2\x80\x99s ever been given\xe2\x80\x94advice which, in his true contrary fashion, also happens to be the best advice he didn\xe2\x80\x99t take.

\xe2\x80\x9c[Someone told me,] \xe2\x80\x98Don\xe2\x80\x99t stay more than three months in a disaster zone without taking a couple of weeks off.\xe2\x80\x9d But, no, Penn didn\xe2\x80\x99t take a few weeks off, or even just stay for a few months\xe2\x80\x94he stayed for nine\xe2\x80\xa6 months\xe2\x80\xa6 straight. \xe2\x80\x9cI made the mistake of not taking that advice,\xe2\x80\x9d he admits with a rueful smile. \xe2\x80\x9cI think I went a little kooky.\xe2\x80\x9d

Just chalk it up to part of his charm. However, by living in Haiti for so long, he got to know the people\xe2\x80\x94the rich and the poor, the women and men, the rural and urban dwellers. He educated himself, he listened, and he learned. \xe2\x80\x9c[Once you] start to get a feel for the place, [you] know you\xe2\x80\x99ll never really know the place,\xe2\x80\x9d he shares. \xe2\x80\x9c[You] know that you\xe2\x80\x99re going to have to use your best instinct[s] about who to trust, who to learn from, who to question, and who to challenge and be challenged by. It\xe2\x80\x99s a long process, but we\xe2\x80\x99ve had a lot of success.\xe2\x80\x9d

Part of the reason for that success is that he was able to let go, to delegate, to cede control. \xe2\x80\x9cAt a certain point, I stopped calling the shots,\xe2\x80\x9d he explains. \xe2\x80\x9cI had shot-callers that were living the life, that were Haitian. Like anything else, I had to develop good relationships and trust them.\xe2\x80\x9d

Trust isn\xe2\x80\x99t something Penn gives easily or quickly, but something he chooses pragmatically, at least in his business dealings. As the evidence of Haiti Takes Root should convey, he\xe2\x80\x99s a \xe2\x80\x98big picture\xe2\x80\x99 kind of guy. He doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have time to sweat the small stuff; he needed to build a team on the ground who cared.

\xe2\x80\x9cI always joke around because here I have a lot of young volunteers who are definitely what you\xe2\x80\x99d call humanitarians. The daily compassion, weeping at deaths of everybody who had died; I just had no time to do that.\xe2\x80\x9d

This doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean Penn is unfeeling, or cold, or whatever else you would want to call him: his passion for Haiti and its people is genuine. In fact, he cares so much that he almost seems to go into another zone when talking about his work there. The intensity you often see him portray onscreen is 100 percent real. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m a facilitator, so I\xe2\x80\x99m not inclined to get to know everybody intimately,\xe2\x80\x9d he admits, adding, \xe2\x80\x9cI wanted to have a T-shirt that said, \xe2\x80\x98Tell it to the humanitarian.\xe2\x80\x99

The smirk with which he delivers this piece of bluster is pure Penn. True, he might not always be warm and fuzzy, but there\xe2\x80\x99s no disputing the fact that this guy is the very embodiment of a philanthropist. In fact, the Oxford English Dictionary describes a humanitarian as \xe2\x80\x9ca person who seeks to promote human welfare.\xe2\x80\x9d Sorry, Seany, but you fit the bill.

Seriously though, one of his best \xe2\x80\x98big picture\xe2\x80\x99 ideas is to bring people together with music. Each year, guests know they\xe2\x80\x99re in for some world-class entertainment at J/P HRO\xe2\x80\x99s annual charity gala, Help Haiti Home. This is in addition to the ethereally-decorated room, a gourmet dinner, star-studded crowd with wall-to-wall celebrities such as Johnny Depp, Chris Hemsworth and Gwyneth Paltrow and big-name philanthropists like Marc Benioff and Sean Parker, as well as the be-all, end-all of auctions with items up for grabs from masters like Banksy and Jeff Koons.

Some might say that Penn has the cushiest gig while putting together the gala: his sole involvement is being the guy who picks the band. And, when you\xe2\x80\x99re friends with some of the biggest icons in entertainment, that\xe2\x80\x99s not hard\xe2\x80\x94which is why everyone from Coldplay\xe2\x80\x99s Chris Martin and the Red Hot Chili Peppers to U2 and even ex-wife Madonna has performed. Never mind that his event competes with all the hoopla of Golden Globes week\xe2\x80\x94he has built it, and Penn\xe2\x80\x99s disciples do come.

While he can\xe2\x80\x99t reveal who this year\xe2\x80\x99s entertainment will be, he informs us that the gala\xe2\x80\x94which will take place on January 7\xe2\x80\x94has been renamed Haiti Rising, mostly because Haiti is figuratively in a different place now. Since its relocations mandate has been achieved and the country is looking towards its next chapter, the gala\xe2\x80\x99s name is meant to convey its progress.

Strategically, its moniker will also reflect the still-pressing need for financial contributions. Its word tense is telling, after all: it is a country on the rise, but it has not yet peaked.

\xe2\x80\x9cThe needs are different, the resources\xe2\x80\x94or lack of thereof\xe2\x80\x94are different,\xe2\x80\x9d Penn says. \xe2\x80\x9cPeople have to understand that, [although Haiti faded from] the headlines, there\xe2\x80\x99s not big government grants going out there. You might have gotten a lot of your sectors financed on a multi-million dollar grant in the first couple of years after the earthquake, but it\xe2\x80\x99s almost entirely dried up. Everything we do is from private donations at this stage.\xe2\x80\x9d

Those donations are in dire need this year, and the reason isn\xe2\x80\x99t one that Penn is pleased about. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s been a change and it isn\xe2\x80\x99t good news,\xe2\x80\x9d he notes grimly. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve said every year at the event, \xe2\x80\x98Come. Come see Haiti.\xe2\x80\x99 I knew that I could say that and people would be safe\xe2\x80\xa6 but I can\xe2\x80\x99t say that this year.

\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99ve had many foreigners killed, shot and kidnapped,\xe2\x80\x9d he continues quietly. \xe2\x80\x9cThere\xe2\x80\x99s a lot of political instability. Now, that doesn\xe2\x80\x99t mean you can\xe2\x80\x99t be safe again in Haiti. Of course I feel safe there. But, at large, I would not be someone to recommend it right now, and that\xe2\x80\x99s a terrible thing.\xe2\x80\x9d

He\xe2\x80\x99s confident that things will improve but, again, it will take time\xe2\x80\xa6 and finances. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s going to change, it\xe2\x80\x99s going to be OK, but it\xe2\x80\x99s not off the hook,\xe2\x80\x9d he notes, adding that he and his team are hell-bent on raising funds for Haiti.

\xe2\x80\x9cWe\xe2\x80\x99re saying, \xe2\x80\x98Look. Here\xe2\x80\x99s the value of what we\xe2\x80\x99ve been doing, and here\xe2\x80\x99s the color of change in that now. Here\xe2\x80\x99s what we need now that\xe2\x80\x99s different [from our former needs]. Here\xe2\x80\x99s what we want to celebrate that\xe2\x80\x99s different. I just told you a piece of bad news, but it\xe2\x80\x99s not all bad.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d

His goal is to make everyone see the good in his cause, and his star-studded, sold-out event attended by some of the richest and most famous people in the world is the perfect platform. \xe2\x80\x9cI know how much we need to raise every year and [if we don\xe2\x80\x99t raise it], people are going to pay a huge price in Haiti. I feel a lot of pressure, but, knock wood, we\xe2\x80\x99ll continue to have great support.\xe2\x80\x9d

If he had one gripe it\xe2\x80\x99s that, in his opinion, the same ten people are the ones giving over and over again. Sure, in 2015 and 2016, Help Haiti Home raised $6 million and $7 million, respectively, but it baffles Penn that, among a crowd that has so much, most seem to give so little.

\xe2\x80\x9cThere are a few extraordinary people that come, but then you have a room that is full mostly of people that are not giving anything. They eat, stargaze and watch the band but, honestly, I don\xe2\x80\x99t think there\xe2\x80\x99s a person in that room that can\xe2\x80\x99t afford $25. I always wonder about that.\xe2\x80\x9d

HAITI IS THE FOCUS, BUT HOLLYWOOD IS STILL THERE

Throughout his career, Penn has been called many things\xe2\x80\x94not all of which were positive. But, then, this is Hollywood in the digital age. Everyone\xe2\x80\x99s a critic.

If we\xe2\x80\x99re talking about the good stuff\xe2\x80\x94and we are\xe2\x80\x94there\xe2\x80\x99s a lot. His humanitarianism is the most obvious. In addition to his work with Haiti, he was fully hands-on in the relief effort post-Hurricane Katrina. He\xe2\x80\x99s received several substantial honors, including being named Ambassador at Large for Haiti in 2012 and being presented with the 2012 Peace Summit Award at the 12th World Summit of Nobel Peace Laureates.

But Penn, a longtime activist and promoter of civil rights, has always been one to stand up for his beliefs. In 2002, he penned a prescient open letter, published in The Washington Post and The New York Times, to President George W. Bush against the planned invasion of Iraq. Furthermore, he traveled to Baghdad and Tehran in 2002 and 2003 to report for the San Francisco Chronicle. He has interviewed Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez and Cuba\xe2\x80\x99s President Raul Castro for The Nation, the latter of which was Castro\xe2\x80\x99s first-ever interview with a foreign journalist. In 2013, Penn also played a vital role in getting wrongfully imprisoned American entrepreneur Jacob Ostreicher released from a Bolivian prison, for which he was honored by the Aleph Institute in 2015. Plus, no one can forget his most recent effort, a secret interview for Rolling Stone with Mexican drug lord Joaquin \xe2\x80\x98El Chapo\xe2\x80\x99 Guzman.

This is a guy you can peel like an onion, layer after layer after layer. And, yes, he\xe2\x80\x99s still the Hollywood icon\xe2\x80\x94a five-time Academy Award-nominated actor, taking home the coveted Best Actor trophies for Clint Eastwood\xe2\x80\x99s Mystic River in 2004 and Gus Van Sant\xe2\x80\x99s Milk in 2009, who has also directed five feature films, including the critically-acclaimed Into the Wild, Indian Runner and The Pledge. (And those are just the highlights; it would actually take pages to cover all that Penn has done since he began his career with the 1981 film, Taps.) This fall, he begins shooting The Professor and the Madman, directed by Farhad Safinia\xe2\x80\x94another unprecedented first, given that this film allows him to star alongside Mel Gibson. The two have been talking about doing the film, which is based on Simon Winchester\xe2\x80\x99s 1998 book of the same name, for 12 years. Penn will play \xe2\x80\x98Madman\xe2\x80\x99 Dr. W.C. Minor in this true story of the creation of the Oxford English Dictionary, a man who submitted more than 10,000 entries to the project as an inmate at an asylum for the criminally insane to Gibson\xe2\x80\x99s OED founder, Professor James Murray.

Though there\xe2\x80\x99s been a lot of hype and discussion about the project, Penn is keeping mum. \xe2\x80\x9cWe just didn\xe2\x80\x99t [work together before],\xe2\x80\x9d he says. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t know why. [But I took the role because] it\xe2\x80\x99s a great project, I get to work with Mel and it\xe2\x80\x99s a beautifully written script.\xe2\x80\x9d

He\xe2\x80\x99s far more vocal on his thoughts regarding the upcoming presidential election, expressing his preference to Stephen Colbert on The Late Show: \xe2\x80\x9cEither you can [\xe2\x80\xa6] go out and vote in a very big way for someone like Hillary Clinton\xe2\x80\x94who you can then challenge and support, which is the only way that a president can have any success\xe2\x80\x94and you stick it out for four years,\xe2\x80\x9d he says, \xe2\x80\x9cOr we can just masturbate our way into hell with a guy who looks like the only blonde magician.\xe2\x80\x9d

While his opinionated vote isn\xe2\x80\x99t surprising, Penn is a man whose overall actions still are. He uncharacteristically showed up to present at the pop-centric iHeartRadio Music Festival in Las Vegas this September, then popped up on several talk shows out of the blue to tout a free audiobook, Bob Honey Who Just Do Stuff, by a mysterious author named Pappy Pariah\xe2\x80\x94who may or may not be Penn himself in disguise. The point is, he might be a humanitarian and award-winning actor, but he\xe2\x80\x99s still a rebel and all-around badass who does exactly what he wants for reasons that, though they might not make sense to others, always, always have a purpose for Penn.

But has one facet of his personality hurt another? Has his \xe2\x80\x98rebel without a cause\xe2\x80\x99 persona of the past harmed the actual present-day rebel with one? Penn doesn\xe2\x80\x99t know and, quite frankly, he doesn\xe2\x80\x99t care. \xe2\x80\x9cI don\xe2\x80\x99t read anything about myself in current tense, but I\xe2\x80\x99m aware of stuff,\xe2\x80\x9d he admits. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99m aware of extremes. I\xe2\x80\x99m always surprised by anything very positive or anything very negative.

\xe2\x80\x9cI can imagine, based on things I\xe2\x80\x99ve heard about myself, that nobody would show up at [my] damn event because of my involvement, you know?\xe2\x80\x9d he continues. \xe2\x80\x9cI can imagine that and, yet, people come out. I put one foot in front of the other, and it is what it is.\xe2\x80\x9d

While the jury\xe2\x80\x99s still out on whether public perception has helped or hurt him, his celebrity status has only benefitted his cause. What\xe2\x80\x99s more, he feels it\xe2\x80\x99s a civic duty to affect change if you have the platform to stand on. \xe2\x80\x9cIf you\xe2\x80\x99re in the acting or film business, where your major job is to share things, then you ought not to be [in the business] if you don\xe2\x80\x99t,\xe2\x80\x9d he says.

Still, truth be told, he doesn\xe2\x80\x99t really dig the \xe2\x80\x98philanthropist\xe2\x80\x99 label\xe2\x80\x94or any label, for that matter. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s all just one thing,\xe2\x80\x9d he says. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s every day, putting your feet in your pants. It\xe2\x80\x99s acting and working in Haiti. It all feels like, for me, the same job. It\xe2\x80\x99s a really lucky life and a really fortunate one, but it\xe2\x80\x99s all just life to me.\xe2\x80\x9d'

b"If there's anyone that knows how to make a sartorial statement, it the Kardashian-Jenner family. Whether they're walking down the street or stepping onto the red carpet, these women always look great. And this time is no different. Kendall Jenner wore a crystal dress to the 2017 Met Gala. As in, it was made out of nothing but 85,000 crystals. It comes as no surprise that she nailed yet another red carpet ensemble, but this might just be her most unconventional look yet.

The model typically sticks to cutouts on the Met Gala red carpet. It seems like every year the cutouts get more and more intricate too. But, with this year's theme being Rei Kawakubo \xe2\x80\x94 aka all about the fabric \xe2\x80\x94 Jenner amped up her look to do the exact opposite. She stepped onto the red carpet in a La Perla Haute Couture Collection gown designed by Creative Director Julia Haart that was made but nothing but 85,000 hand painted and placed crystals. Basically, it's the chicest net you'll ever see walk the red carpet.

Jenner kept the rest of the look simple. Because when you're wearing nothing but accessories, you don't need to wear any. This look is definitely a piece of art to say the least. But don't just take me word for it. Here's the full head-to-toe look, so you can take it all in.

Neilson Barnard/Getty Images Entertainment/Getty Images

This entire dress was one big accessory! It doesn't get more gorgeous than that.

Theo Wargo/Getty Images Entertainment/Getty Images

Jenner can rock anything, and she wears this crystalized dress like a pro.

Theo Wargo/Getty Images Entertainment/Getty Images

Because clothing is overrated."

b"The beginning of the new year comes with the irresistible urge to start over fresh, which means it's a great time to get a haircut. This decade's first big hair trends include looks at every length that can be tailored to your hair texture and personal style. For anyone with a blunt bob \xe2\x80\x94 the most popular haircut of the past few years \xe2\x80\x94 you probably already guessed that the cut will still be going strong into the next decade. But there will be a few tweaks. As seen on Kerry Washington, 2020's bob has textured, softer edges, and looks amazing whether you part it down the middle or off to the side. RELATED: The 10 Hairstyles You'll See Everywhere This Winter But if you swear that 2020 is going to be the year you finally grow out your hair, let Jennifer Lopez and Kim Kardashian's extra-long lengths be your inspiration. Or, you can get the look instantly with the help of some clip in extensions. To help you figure out how to wear your hair in the new year, we've rounded up the five biggest haircut trends of 2020, so you'll be sure of what you want before you head to the salon in January. VIDEO: The Five Biggest Haircut Trends of 2020"

b'At the 2017 Met Gala, the clothing spoke louder than the Instagram likes

Cara Kelly | USA TODAY

Show Caption Hide Caption Extreme, eye-popping fashion reigns at Met Gala Entertainment Editor Cara Kelly and Digital Editor Maeve McDermott talk about the hottest fashion at the 2017 Met Gala.

NEW YORK \xe2\x80\x94 Rei Kawakubo skittered up the stairs of the Metropolitan Museum of Art Monday night, only faintly glancing at the photographers and reporters chanting her name from the sides of the red, or rather, blue carpet. A stranger to the scene would have hardly known she was an important guest at the A-list circus that is the annual Costume Institute Gala, let alone the star of the whole show.

The reclusive designer, who founded label Comme des Gar\xc3\xa7ons in 1969, is the focus of the museum\xe2\x80\x99s latest exhibit and a rare bird in an industry full of peacocks. She scarcely gives interviews, doesn\xe2\x80\x99t have personal social media accounts and won\xe2\x80\x99t measure her success on praise from others.

Her designs speak for themselves. And in that way, her ethos was the unifier of a disparate and relatively quiet blue carpet.

Guests to the yearly fundraiser held in honor of the exhibit are encouraged to channel the subject of the new showcase, which typically happens with varying degrees of success. The attendees who best hit Monday's theme \xe2\x80\x94 channeling Kawakubo through her own creations or by working with another designer in attendance \xe2\x80\x94 made their way up the steps of the Met without much fuss. Helen Lasichanh, the wife of co-host Pharrell Williams, hit the carpet early in a look from one of Kawakubo\xe2\x80\x99s most recent collections which experimented with silhouettes and bound the body without armholes. Like Kawakubo, she barely spoke to waiting reporters, because when wearing an outfit like that, what\xe2\x80\x99s left to say?

Pharrell, also in pieces from the designer, focused on his love of the brand when speaking with reporters.

"What I feel is lucky and blessed to be able to do it, because its one of my heros," he said of co-hosting the night. "Rei Kawakubo is the best of the best. Comme des Gar\xc3\xa7ons is one of my favorite brands."

Rihanna climbed towards the Met entrance in another bulbous Comme des Gar\xc3\xa7ons creation, and like Lasichanh, let what she was wearing do the communicating. Fans screamed but the Barbadian singer and fashionista kept mostly silent behind the blossoming, 3-D petals.

Wait, what did they wear to the Met Gala? And the nominees for worst dressed at the 2017 Met Gala are\xe2\x80\xa6

Black-ish\xe2\x80\x99s Tracee Ellis Ross demurely acknowledged her cocoon-dress was also made by Comme des Gar\xc3\xa7ons before striding inside, no time for interviews, her wrangler told waiting reporters.

Katy Perry solemnly processed in a straight line to the museum's door, dragging her lengthy red Maison Margiela train and veil behind her.

Others likewise had success channeling the avant-garde dress code without wearing the band tee-shirt to the concert. Priyanka Chopra and Ralph Lauren had a clever play on Kawakubo's legacy.

"Everything that comes out of her is so androgynous and has no lines as far as gender, and this was sort of that," Chopra said. "A trench gown."

Others were at least drawn out of their comfort zones. Claire Foy in Erdem, Candice Swanepoel in Topshop and Kate Bosworth in Tory Burch were among the many guests to say their ensembles for the evening were the most over-the-top they'd ever worn.

But if their choices spoke for themselves, so too did the starlets whose clothes alluded to the fact that they missed the entire concept.

\xe2\x80\x9cI work around the figure, but I am never limited by what the figure has to be,\xe2\x80\x9d Kawakubo says in the guide to her exhibition.

So what would she think of the now-exhausted naked dress trend that showed up again on the likes of Kendall Jenner? One can only imagine she\xe2\x80\x99d find the unfaltering obsession with figure-baring outfits to be limiting. Lingerie brand La Perla was behind the thin slip of a garment and black thong \xe2\x80\x94 in what could be called a poorly planned marketing splash, though the reality TV star\xe2\x80\x99s Instagram followers likely ate it up.

And therein lies a central reason to what makes Kawakubo's exhibit so refreshing. In the age of President Trump and constant self-promotion and validation on social media, a strong voice that's focused on what's new and never seen before is a mythical thing.'

b'There is absolutely nothing good or right with this new creation from McDonald\xe2\x80\x99s.

McDonald's just unveiled its new invention: the "Frork," a fork made of French fries https://t.co/oc6goZ9PW9 pic.twitter.com/HKKvhcdisU \xe2\x80\x94 NBC News (@NBCNews) May 1, 2017

The fast-food promotion is one of the greatest cultural gifts America gave the world. Most of us don\xe2\x80\x99t get to experience what seasonal produce some chef named Serge is offering at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but darn it if I can\xe2\x80\x99t go to Hardee\xe2\x80\x99s and eat a burger with some weird boneless ribs on it that were marketed on Shark Tank (yes, this is a thing).

These limited-time offers are where fast food gets weird, and when fast food gets weird, it gets fun. There are a couple of basic rules for running a good promotion.

Did you cram more crap on your food? Why didn\xe2\x80\x99t you cram more crap on your food?

That\xe2\x80\x99s it. It\xe2\x80\x99s simple. What McDonald\xe2\x80\x99s has done with this whole \xe2\x80\x9cfrork\xe2\x80\x9d fiasco is asked me to change my eating habits. It makes no damn sense. This is the veil being pulled off corporate America. Some dude in a $5,000 suit named \xe2\x80\x9cTodd,\xe2\x80\x9d probably with a \xe2\x80\x9cJr.\xe2\x80\x9d or \xe2\x80\x9cIII\xe2\x80\x9d on the end of his name, was looking for brownie points by saying: \xe2\x80\x9cYou know, I think America wants an edible fork.\xe2\x80\x9d

NO I DON\xe2\x80\x99T WANT A DAMN EDIBLE FORK, TODD. I WANT TO CRAM THE FOOD INTO MY MOUTH CHUTE WITH MY UNWASHED HANDS BEFORE BLOWING MY NOSE ON THE GREASE-COVERED BAG AND SHAMEFULLY REALIZING I FINISHED AN ENTIRE MEAL AT A STOP LIGHT AND THEN SEEING THAT THE PERSON IN THE CAR NEXT TO ME VIDEO\xe2\x80\x99D ALL THIS. THAT\xe2\x80\x99S WHAT I WANT, TODD.

The frork appeals to a very limited part of the fast food Venn diagram, all of whom are idiots. It\xe2\x80\x99s people who want to keep their hands clean while eating, but also who want to get grease all over their fingers while they cram greasy fries into a fork-shaped holder.

GOD, TODD, I SWEAR I HATE YOU SO MUCH.

They even released an infomercial about these things.

Look, I know what you\xe2\x80\x99re thinking: This is all a tongue-in-cheek joke. I don\xe2\x80\x99t care that it\xe2\x80\x99s a joke. Time and effort were wasted on the frork that could have been used working out how to give me portable poutine at fast-food prices.

\xe2\x80\x9cA limited supply of Frorks will be available with the purchase of a Signature Crafted Recipes sandwich on May 5 at participating restaurants. These sandwiches sell for between $4.99 and $5.19.\xe2\x80\x9d

Gosh wow. I really couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have worked out this was going to be a limited supply. You mean to tell me that this trash idea created by an idiot named Todd (probably) is only going to be a small test? Wow \xe2\x80\x94 couldn\xe2\x80\x99t have worked that one out.

And you know the part that really annoys me. There\xe2\x80\x99s going to be someone out there who calls themselves a \xe2\x80\x9cfast food historian\xe2\x80\x9d who\xe2\x80\x99s going to line up on May 5 and try to get a frork.

I have such a high tolerance for bad promotions, but goodness if this doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make me mad. I\xe2\x80\x99m just going to try to forget this happened, ignore the frork ads, and wistfully lose myself in the Pizza Hut \xe2\x80\x9cPriazzo\xe2\x80\x9d ad when they tried to make deep dish pizza in the \xe2\x80\x9980s.

P.S. Still hate you, Todd.'

b'For Jennifer Lopez, spending seven years as a judge on talent competition shows hasn\xe2\x80\x99t just been about mentoring young performers, but also about improving herself.

The star, who spent five years on the \xe2\x80\x9cAmerican Idol\xe2\x80\x9d judging panel, is now on the second season of her show \xe2\x80\x9cWorld of Dance,\xe2\x80\x9d for which she is a judge and executive producer.

\xe2\x80\x9cI love mentoring, I love being part of someone\xe2\x80\x99s journey in that way, and I also learn so much from watching and analyzing performances all the time,\xe2\x80\x9d Lopez told Variety during the show\xe2\x80\x99s press day earlier this year. \xe2\x80\x9cI feel like it\xe2\x80\x99s made me a better singer, dancer, performer, entertainer myself. I feel like I\xe2\x80\x99ve grown leaps and bounds since \xe2\x80\x98American Idol\xe2\x80\x99 just because of that \xe2\x80\x94 because when you start picking things apart you\xe2\x80\x99re like \xe2\x80\x98Oh, I do that.\xe2\x80\x99\xe2\x80\x9d

\xe2\x80\x9cWorld of Dance,\xe2\x80\x9d which started production at the end of January and is set to air over the summer, features dancers from all over the world competing for the $1 million prize in front of judges Lopez, Ne-Yo, Derek Hough and host Jenna Dewan. This season, the show will expand the number of young competitors \xe2\x80\x94 with 50 percent of contestants being under the age of 18 \xe2\x80\x94 as well as increase the total number of dancers.

\xe2\x80\x9cLast year was such a success for us, and we were so excited about that. It really kind of exceeded all of our expectations,\xe2\x80\x9d Lopez said. \xe2\x80\x9cI knew we had the ingredients for a beautiful show, but you never know what\xe2\x80\x99s going to happen, so it was just exciting to be able to come back again. And we\xe2\x80\x99re going to give them more of what they loved the first time.\xe2\x80\x9d

The show was a passion project for the singer and actress, who calls dance her \xe2\x80\x9cfirst love,\xe2\x80\x9d and wanted to give hardworking dancers their time in the spotlight.

\xe2\x80\x9cThey\xe2\x80\x99ve been in the background for so long, and people don\xe2\x80\x99t realize how much dedication, commitment, passion and love it takes to be a dancer,\xe2\x80\x9d she said. \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s just like any artist in the world, you have to love it, and I just love providing a platform where they get to be not a step away or a step behind but up front and the star.\xe2\x80\x9d

Ne-Yo echoed a similar sentiment, saying, \xe2\x80\x9cThe height of a lot of dancers is dancing behind somebody else, and for the amount of sacrifice and blood, sweat and tears that you have to put into it in order to become great, it was almost sad that there was no platform for these people to be the star.\xe2\x80\x9d

As for why the show was such a success in it\xe2\x80\x99s first year, crowning French duo Les Twins as its winners and leading as the top new summer series, Hough says the key is \xe2\x80\x9cjust the love, the love of dance,\xe2\x80\x9d while Dewan thinks it\xe2\x80\x99s due to the uplifting message.

\xe2\x80\x9cI think when you\xe2\x80\x99re done with your day and [are] with your family, you want something you can watch all together and you want your popcorn \xe2\x80\x94 you want to be entertained and you want to feel good \xe2\x80\x94 and I think that\xe2\x80\x99s a bit of what we\xe2\x80\x99ve tapped into,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.

\xe2\x80\x9cWorld of Dance\xe2\x80\x9d premieres May 29 on NBC. It has also already been renewed for a third season.'

b'Update, 5/2: Jaden Smith caused a stir (and countless memes) after carrying his chopped dreadlocks on the Met Gala red carpet last night, but the actor explained that the reason behind his bizarre accessory is actually very sweet.

Kate Hudson and her boyfriend, Danny Fujikawa, welcomed their first child together, a daughter named Rani Rose Hudson Fujikawa, on October 2, 2018. She added, "Everyone is doing well and happy as can be. Our family thanks you for all the love and blessings that have been sent our way and we send ours right back."

b'From there, you transition to the leg press machine , but instead of placing your feet hip-width apart, you put them close together so that your knees are touching. This instruction was a bit of red flag, because having your feet closer together can put more pressure on your joints and make it more difficult to move the weight, Stone says. "There is no major advantage to doing the leg press with your feet together; it just works different muscle groups," she says. For me, it was a little too hard to successfully do the leg press with my feet together. If you need a challenge on this machine, it\'s probably best to use a heavier weight and keep a neutral stance in your feet so you don\'t sacrifice form.'

b"Vest and trousers (part of three-piece suit, $2,675) and shirt ($395) by Dolce & Gabbana; Coupole Classic Power Reserve watch ($1,650) by Rado. Christian Anwander

In 2017, British actor Joe Alwyn shot four films across three continents in less than twelve months, and the resulting projects, all of which hit theaters in the latter half of this year, reveal his impressive range in a series of small but critical roles. First came Operation Finale, about the hunt for Nazi officer Adolf Eichmann (Ben Kingsley), with Alwyn as Eichmann\xe2\x80\x99s son. Then there was Boy Erased, a film about gay-\xc2\xadconversion therapy, in which Alwyn, alongside a cast including Nicole Kidman, Russell Crowe, and Lucas Hedges, played a closeted predator. The Favourite soon followed, a riotous period piece with Alwyn, as a besotted courtier, revealing a knack for physical comedy opposite Emma Stone.

Coat ($930) by AMI Alexandre Mattiussi; turtleneck ($980) by Prada; trousers ($348) by Boss; sneakers ($180) by New Balance x Stu\xcc\x88ssy. Christian Anwander

This month, the twenty-\xc2\xadseven-year-old appears in a very different kind of period film, Mary Queen of Scots. Directed by Josie Rourke, it tells the true story of two young queens who are cousins and rivals for the English crown, with a fierce and brilliant Saoirse Ronan in the role of Mary and Margot Robbie as a powerful yet vulnerable Elizabeth I. Alwyn plays Robert Dudley, Elizabeth\xe2\x80\x99s right hand. \xe2\x80\x9cHe isn\xe2\x80\x99t driven by politics and ambition and power in the same way as the other male characters,\xe2\x80\x9d says Alwyn. \xe2\x80\x9cThe others try to circle the women and use them for their own advantage. That\xe2\x80\x99s not to say that my character is incapable of doing that, but he has higher priorities or higher feelings\xe2\x80\x94his love and loyalty to Elizabeth.\xe2\x80\x9d

Sweater ($2,740) by Louis Vuitton; trousers ($780) and boots ($1,095) by Givenchy. Christian Anwander

Alwyn\xe2\x80\x99s big break came in a shot-out-of-a-cannon moment when Ang Lee cast him, at age twenty-four and fresh out of school, as the lead in the highly anticipated wartime drama Billy Lynn\xe2\x80\x99s Long Halftime Walk. The film stumbled at the box office, but Alwyn remains grateful: \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s still the most amazing experience I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever had.\xe2\x80\x9d Landing a starring role so soon could have turned his head, but the young actor stayed focused on his work and regrouped by taking a number of smaller parts. \xe2\x80\x9cSince that film, I\xe2\x80\x99ve tried to make a conscious effort to find projects where, if there were supporting roles where I could learn and be surrounded by a great cast of actors and filmmakers and crew, then that was what I wanted to do.\xe2\x80\x9d

Jacket ($1,950), shirt ($690), and trousers ($790) by Bottega Veneta; belt ($575) by Louis Vuitton. Christian Anwander

That approach led Alwyn not only to create a diverse r\xc3\xa9sum\xc3\xa9 but also to work with a diverse group of directors. He\xe2\x80\x99s currently shooting Harriet, about abolitionist Harriet Tubman, directed by Kasi Lemmons (Eve\xe2\x80\x99s Bayou). Throughout, Alwyn has retained an apprentice-\xc2\xadlike humility. \xe2\x80\x9cI still find it a strange readjustment when you go back to set,\xe2\x80\x9d he says. \xe2\x80\x9cTo do your work in a way where you don\xe2\x80\x99t feel anxious and completely consumed by anxiety, it takes experience and practice.\xe2\x80\x9d

Coat ($3,900) and trousers ($890) by CALVIN KLEIN 205W39NYC; Calvin Klein Underwear T-shirt, Alwyn\xe2\x80\x99s own. Christian Anwander

His levelheadedness has also helped him navigate the incessant curiosity about his relationship with superstar Taylor Swift. b'Disneyland Paris apologized after a 3-year-old was told he could not take part in a \xe2\x80\x9cPrincess for a Day\xe2\x80\x9d experience just because he is a boy.

Noah, who is a super fan of Princess Elsa in the film \xe2\x80\x9cFrozen\xe2\x80\x9d was \xe2\x80\x9cbuzzing with excitement\xe2\x80\x9d when he learned about the makeover opportunity at the Disneyland Hotel, the boy\xe2\x80\x99s mother, Hayley McLean-Glass, wrote in an open letter on her blog. The hotel is located near the entrance of the park in the suburbs of Paris, France.

McLean-Glass, who is from Devon, England, wrote that she decided to book the experience for Noah as early Christmas gift.

\xe2\x80\x9cI knew that there would be NOTHING he'd love more than to get to wear a pretty dress, put make up on like Mummy does and have his photo taken being one of his beloved Disney Princesses,\xe2\x80\x9d she wrote.

Disneyland Paris' description of the service on its website reads: "Grant every little girl's wish with a real Princess's make-up and hair-styling session; a fairytale transformation they'll treasure forever."

Noah McLean-Glass, three, stands next to his mother, Hayley McLean-Glass. NBC News

The mother said she was devastated when she received an email reply back saying "at this time it is not possible to book princess for a day for a boy," NBC News' British partner, ITV News reported.

\xe2\x80\x9cI was so angry, I literally couldn\xe2\x80\x99t stop shaking for half an hour afterwards \xe2\x80\x94 I was just so shocked,\xe2\x80\x9d she told ITV. \xe2\x80\x9cI mean, I\xe2\x80\x99m his mother and if I\xe2\x80\x99m OK with him doing it, who are Disney to tell me that he can\xe2\x80\x99t do that?\xe2\x80\x9d

Disneyland Paris said they \xe2\x80\x9csincerely apologized\xe2\x80\x9d to Noah and his mother in a statement to ITV News and that it was an \xe2\x80\x9cisolated incident.\xe2\x80\x9d

\xe2\x80\x9cAn isolated incident, the cast member\xe2\x80\x99s response is not reflective of any policy or belief held here at Disneyland Paris,\xe2\x80\x9d read the statement \xe2\x80\x94 Disneyland calls all of their employees "cast members."

FILE: Visitors walk toward the Sleeping Beauty's Castle, background, at Disneyland Paris in Chessy, France, east of Paris, May 12, 2015. Michel Euler / AP

It continued, \xe2\x80\x9cWe are going to ensure this does not happen again."

\xe2\x80\x9cOf course, both boys and girls are welcome to enjoy The Princess For a Day experience in addition to all our other special activities,\xe2\x80\x9d the statement added.

McLean-Glass said she felt her son had been discriminated against because of his gender.

"The way I look at it, if a little girl went to Disneyland and wanted to do a pirate experience or a 'Spider-Man' experience, there would be no way that they would stop a girl from doing that because there would be an uproar," she said. "So why is it different for a boy?"'

b'Prince Charles\xe2\x80\x99 transition to king might already be in the works, and here\xe2\x80\x99s what we know

We just might start seeing Prince Charles play a bigger role in royal events. According to E! and the U.K.\xe2\x80\x99s The Times, the prince\xe2\x80\x99s staff is reportedly planning his transition to king. It\xe2\x80\x99s all part of a bigger plan called \xe2\x80\x9cProject 70.\xe2\x80\x9d We love hearing royal family news, so we\xe2\x80\x99re all ears. (Hey, even the real queen watches The Crown.)

Project 70 refers to Prince Charles becoming king by his 70th birthday.

That\xe2\x80\x99s not too far away \xe2\x80\x94 Prince Charles turns 70 on November 14, 2018. According to The Times, his staff is \xe2\x80\x9ckeen to \xe2\x80\x98accelerate\xe2\x80\x99 plans to increase his involvement in key royal events\xe2\x80\x9d by then.

Here\xe2\x80\x99s what that involvement might look like, according to The Times.

"Prince Charles's team is thought to want him to be more involved in occasions such as the Royal Maundy service. [This is] when the monarch distributes alms to pensioners on the day before Good Friday, and in Commonwealth events."

The idea of Queen Elizabeth not being the queen is practically unimaginable. But she is 91 years old, after all. And Prince Charles has been the heir apparent since February 1952, when Elizabeth became queen.

So far these reports have been denied by Clarence House, the royal residence of Charles, Prince of Wales.

But tension has reportedly been afoot amongst our favorite royals.

Rumor has it that Prince Charles affected the decision to fire the Queen\xe2\x80\x99s private secretary, Sir Christopher Geidt. This reportedly added to the tension between Clarence House and Buckingham place.

The two presented a statement that reads:

"At the time of the announcement, the lord chamberlain paid tribute to the major contribution made by Sir Christopher, who in turn commended the support offered to Her Majesty by other members of the royal family. Recent years have seen an ever-closer working relationship between all the different royal households and their respective teams... Beyond that, we are not going to engage with a story based on rumours from unnamed sources."'

b'WASHINGTON \xe2\x80\x94 President Donald Trump has weighed in on the Emmys, which were heavy on humor and swipes at his expense.

\xe2\x80\x9cI was saddened to see how bad the ratings were on the Emmys last night \xe2\x80\x93 the worst ever. Smartest people of them all are the \xe2\x80\x98DEPLORABLES,'\xe2\x80\x9d he wrote on on Tuesday night, two days after Sunday\xe2\x80\x99s Primetime Emmy Awards telecast. The President is in New York, staying at Trump Tower, during the United Nations General Assembly.

I was saddened to see how bad the ratings were on the Emmys last night \xe2\x80\x93 the worst ever. Smartest people of them all are the "DEPLORABLES." \xe2\x80\x94 Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) September 20, 2017

The Emmys, broadcast by CBS, were about on par with last year\xe2\x80\x99s ceremony in terms of total viewers. Sunday\xe2\x80\x99s awards ceremony averaged 11.4 million viewers, compared to 2016\xe2\x80\x99s 11.3 million, its lowest ever. The telecast also averaged a 2.5 rating in adults 18-49, dropping below last year\xe2\x80\x99s low point of a 2.8.

Host Stephen Colbert spent part of his monologue skewering Trump\xe2\x80\x99s own fixation with the Emmys, including his past tweets that disparaged the awards handed out by the Television Academy after he failed to win any Emmy trophies for \xe2\x80\x9cThe Apprentice.\xe2\x80\x9d In a tweet from 2013, Trump cited political bias for his lack of Emmy wins.

According to many, and while nominated, I would have won the Emmy many times except for my politics. @PrimetimeEmmys \xe2\x80\x94 Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 14, 2013

Kellyanne Conway, counselor to the president, criticized the \xe2\x80\x9cpoliticized\xe2\x80\x9d show for the \xe2\x80\x9csameness\xe2\x80\x9d of the attacks on Trump.

\xe2\x80\x9cIt looks like Americans are tuning out,\xe2\x80\x9d she said on \xe2\x80\x9cFox & Friends.\xe2\x80\x9d

Then she addressed stars who appeared on the stage. \xe2\x80\x9cThey want you to stick to your knitting. They want you to stick to the stuff that other people write for you.\xe2\x80\x9d

She did, however, praise Sean Spicer for his Emmy cameo, in which he made fun of his own post-inauguration press conference in which he chided the media never its reporting on Trump\xe2\x80\x99s inaugural crowd size. Spicer\xe2\x80\x99s appearance has drawn a backlash from Trump detractors who criticized Colbert and Emmy producers for milking laughs out of a political operative who had been a champion of Trump\xe2\x80\x99s polarizing agenda.

\xe2\x80\x9cThis is something that folks in Hollywood often lack \xe2\x80\x94 which is introspection and good humor,\xe2\x80\x9d Conway said of Spicer.

Trump spoke at the UN earlier on Tuesday in a speech in which he said that the U.S. would \xe2\x80\x9ctotally destroy\xe2\x80\x9d North Korea if the U.S. is \xe2\x80\x9cforced to defend itself or its allies.\xe2\x80\x9d'

The wrongful death lawsuit against Jim Carrey keeps getting uglier.

A note written by Carrey\xe2\x80\x99s ex-girlfriend Cathriona White has surfaced, alleging the actor \xe2\x80\x9cintroduced\xe2\x80\x9d her to multiple things, including hard drugs and prostitutes. The opposition\xe2\x80\x99s lawyer has already accused Carrey of giving White three sexually transmitted infections (STIs). The letter was allegedly written in April 2013.

White intentionally overdosed on prescription medication, which was supposedly provided by Carrey. The wrongful death lawsuit against Carrey was filed by White\xe2\x80\x99s estranged husband, Mark Burton, and White\xe2\x80\x99s mother, Brigid Sweetman, who amalgamated their complaints into one single case.

WATCH BELOW: The latest on the Jim Carrey lawsuit

Story continues below advertisement

The body of the 30-year-old makeup artist, originally from Ireland, was discovered in her Los Angeles home in September 2015. She and Carrey, 55, met in 2012, and dated on and off.

There was some hope for a settlement out-of-court between the parties, but Burton and Sweetman\xe2\x80\x99s lawyer, Michael Avenatti, has insisted multiple times in the past that he wants Carrey to take the stand at trial and has been demanding his deposition for months.

On Friday, Carrey filed a counter-complaint against Burton, Sweetman and White\xe2\x80\x99s lawyer Filippo Machino (along with Machino\xe2\x80\x99s office, The X Law Group). Carrey once again alleged that the lawsuit is an extortion attempt.

https://twitter.com/JimCarrey/status/913891847570722816

In response to the counter-complaint, Avenatti released the 2013 letter.

Composed on an iPad in Notes, the note is meant for Carrey and was released by Avenatti after the legal team uncovered it \xe2\x80\x9cduring a forensic examination of Ms. White\xe2\x80\x99s iPad.\xe2\x80\x9d It\xe2\x80\x99s unclear if Carrey or anyone else read the note prior to White\xe2\x80\x99s death.

READ MORE: Jim Carrey responds to ex-girlfriend\xe2\x80\x99s mother\xe2\x80\x99s lawsuit: it\xe2\x80\x99s a \xe2\x80\x98shakedown\xe2\x80\x99

Avenatti said in a statement that the note is \xe2\x80\x9cwritten in Cat\xe2\x80\x99s own words, [and] shows the world how Jim Carrey treated her while she was alive and the depths of his destructive behavior.\xe2\x80\x9d

Story continues below advertisement

As he\xe2\x80\x99s stated in the past, Avenatti then said he\xe2\x80\x99s looking forward to trying the case in front of a jury.

(Via Michael Avenatti).

In response to the letter, Carrey\xe2\x80\x99s lawyer Ray Boucher said, \xe2\x80\x9cThis note helps establish the evidence that this was pure fraud, and that [White], her lawyers and others were trying to establish a basis for Jim into ultimately settling with her based on these false claims\xe2\x80\xa6 this was part of her and her lawyers\xe2\x80\x99 [sic] campaign to extort money from Jim and ultimately he succumbed.\xe2\x80\x9d

In yet another response, Avenatti responded to Boucher, saying \xe2\x80\x9cJim Carrey is so desperate to avoid the public knowing the truth about his own outrageous conduct that he has now resorted to outlandish accusations against innocent people. As his interview from a few weeks ago shows, the guy is incoherent and unhinged. He needs help.\xe2\x80\x9d

Story continues below advertisement

READ MORE: Jim Carrey responds to \xe2\x80\x98evil\xe2\x80\x99 lawsuit: I will not be exploited

In August, Carrey was permitted by the court to use White\xe2\x80\x99s health records at trial.

Boucher had previously attempted to get the judge to throw the lawsuit out of court, calling it \xe2\x80\x9cmalicious\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9cpredatory.\xe2\x80\x9d Carrey himself has called the lawsuit a \xe2\x80\x9cshakedown,\xe2\x80\x9d and denies any wrongdoing on all accounts.

Boucher contends that White had breast augmentation surgery prior to her death, and had been prescribed painkillers and other pills that ultimately led to her overdose.

\xe2\x80\x9cOne of the issues is her prescription medication,\xe2\x80\x9d said Boucher in court. \xe2\x80\x9cWe know she had breast surgery that month, we know she had oxycodone prescribed to her.\xe2\x80\x9d

READ MORE: Jim Carrey to give deposition in ex-girlfriend\xe2\x80\x99s wrongful death lawsuit

Her family\xe2\x80\x99s legal team attempted to argue against the medical records\xe2\x80\x99 admission on privacy grounds, but Judge Deirdre Hill ruled that the records could be disclosed.

The medical records should also determine whether or not White had any STIs prior to dating Carrey.

The actor will face the jury trial in April 2018.

b'(CNN) An emotional Celine Dion returned to the stage in Las Vegas on Tuesday night, two days after the city and the country were rocked by the deadliest mass shooting in modern American history.

The singer, who has had two long-running residencies in Vegas, the first in 2003, told the crowd proceeds from the night would go to the victims of Sunday's shooting at the Route 91 Harvest Festival and their families.

"Tonight is very different," Dion said ahead of her show, according to videos taken by fans . "After Sunday night's incredibly tragic event, all of us here find ourselves asking a similar question. For you, it's, 'Do we still go to Celine's show on Tuesday night, only two days after the nightmare?' For me, it's, 'Can I still do my show? Should I still do my show only two days after the nightmare?' These are difficult questions."

Dion said she ultimately decided to go on with her performances "to show love and support for those who are affected."

"On Sunday, we lost too many beautiful, innocent souls and so many are still suffering. But tonight, we are going to let these families know that we are supporting them and that we will help them through their tragic loss," she said. "They are going to need a lot of love, a ton of emotional support, as well as a great deal of financial aid."

Read More'

b'The day Corey Feldman met Corey Haim, when they were 14 years old and preparing to work together on the film \xe2\x80\x9cThe Lost Boys,\xe2\x80\x9d they bonded instantly. Both were young Jewish actors who often competed for the same roles. They shared a first name and even a favorite number, sort of. Haim\xe2\x80\x99s was 222. Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s was 22.

As they spoke, it became clear that they also shared horrific histories of abuse.

Haim confided in his new friend that on the set of the 1986 film \xe2\x80\x9cLucas,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9can adult male convinced him that it was perfectly normal for older men and younger boys in the business to have sexual relations, that it was what all the guys do. So they walked off to a secluded area between two trailers . . . and Haim allowed himself to be sodomized.\xe2\x80\x9d

Haim then followed this shocking tale with a question.

\xe2\x80\x9cSo,\xe2\x80\x9d he said to his new bestie. \xe2\x80\x9cI guess we should play around like that, too?\xe2\x80\x9d

The Meal Ticket

In \xe2\x80\x9cCoreyography,\xe2\x80\x9d Feldman \xe2\x80\x94 one of Hollywood\xe2\x80\x99s top child actors in the 1980s with hits like \xe2\x80\x9cStand By Me,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cThe Lost Boys,\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x9cGremlins\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9cThe Goonies\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x94 shares tales of his own abuse at the hands of trusted adults throughout his Hollywood experience.

Along the way, he recounts his often twisted friendship with Haim \xe2\x80\x94 the two spent their teen years partying and living with their molesters (and no, Feldman writes, he did not take Haim up on his suggestion) \xe2\x80\x94 as well as his friendship with Michael Jackson, which, in a sign of how screwed up Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s life was, served as one of his healthiest and most supportive relationships.

Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s troubles began at home. His mother, Sheila, was a former Playboy model with severe depression and drug issues, and his father, Bob, had been in a post-hit version of \xe2\x80\x9960s one-hit wonders Strawberry Alarm Clock and only seemed to care about his son when they were getting high together.

Sheila began telling Feldman how flawed he was at age 4, when she dyed his hair blond, saying, \xe2\x80\x9cYou were supposed to be blond.\xe2\x80\x9d She also tortured him about his weight, calling him fat and eventually force-feeding him diet pills.

When she caught him sneaking two cookies when he was 5, she made him stand facing a wall for an hour, then went off, Feldman writes, on an insane verbal rant.

\xe2\x80\x9cYou have no right to disrespect me like this . . . you ungrateful s \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 t,\xe2\x80\x9d she railed before somehow segueing to, \xe2\x80\x9cDo you realize that most women would die to look like this after two kids? Look at these t \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 s,\xe2\x80\x9d she said, cupping her breasts toward him.

By the time he was 7, Feldman was working as a commercial actor and was relied on as the family bread-winner. He was banned from ever riding a bicycle because, his mother told him, he couldn\xe2\x80\x99t afford to be injured. \xe2\x80\x9cYou have responsibilities now,\xe2\x80\x9d she said.

Unsurprisingly, the starved-for-love Feldman began acting out on-set and became regarded by some as a brat. When he was fired from a TV movie, his mother forced him to remove his clothes as she reached for \xe2\x80\x9ca long wooden dowel . . . [that acted] as a window stop.\xe2\x80\x9d

\xe2\x80\x9c \xe2\x80\x98How could you f \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 ing do this to me?\xe2\x80\x99 she screams. She is out of control, wild-eyed, like an animal. Her face is bright red and blotchy, her cheeks are streaked with mascara. \xe2\x80\x98You know I need this f \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 ing money. I will kill you. I will f \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 ing kill you, you worthless piece of s \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x93 t.\xe2\x80\x9d

Feldman tried to hide under his little brother\xe2\x80\x99s crib as his mother shoved the dowel toward him.

\xe2\x80\x9cShe\xe2\x80\x99s bent at the waist, ramming the pole under the cotton eyelet dust ruffle . . . jabbing at my ribs, my arms, my face,\xe2\x80\x9d he writes. \xe2\x80\x9cMy skin is raw and bleeding. I think that, maybe, she is serious. She really does want to kill me. Then everything goes black.\xe2\x80\x9d

Later that week, she taunts him further.

\xe2\x80\x9c \xe2\x80\x98I\xe2\x80\x99m going to kill you.\xe2\x80\x99 My mother delivers this line in a sing-song cadence, like she\xe2\x80\x99s suggesting we go to a picnic, or make balloon animals, or fly a kite in Chatsworth Park. \xe2\x80\x98On Saturday,\xe2\x80\x99 she says, with a wink.\xe2\x80\x9d

Nights with \xe2\x80\x98Ron\xe2\x80\x99

With such turmoil at home, Feldman sought relief on Hollywood soundstages, where he could interact with other like-minded kids and hopefully be around genuine adult role models. But while Steven Spielberg, who hired him for the first time for \xe2\x80\x9cGremlins,\xe2\x80\x9d and director Richard Donner became trusted and supportive friends, most of the adults he met did him harm.

His father, who managed him for a time, hired an assistant in his early 20s who Feldman calls \xe2\x80\x9cRon.\xe2\x80\x9d Ron struck up an instant friendship with Feldman, who writes, \xe2\x80\x9cIt was almost eerie how similar we were. It was as if he had studied me and was copying my every move.\xe2\x80\x9d

Ron was soon spending all his time with Feldman, taking him out on the town and turning him on to new drugs. One night, after taking a concoction of pills \xe2\x80\x9cthat Ron had made up,\xe2\x80\x9d the woozy teenager felt a hand on his thigh. Ron asked if it was OK and wound up having oral sex with the \xe2\x80\x9cpetrified\xe2\x80\x9d and \xe2\x80\x9crevolted\xe2\x80\x9d Feldman, who was frightened of a confrontation and of alienating his new close friend.

This twisted relationship lasted for years. With none of his family members there for him, Feldman formed relationships with any adults who reached out, and in numerous instances, these men turned out to be pedophiles. In one especially sad aside, he reflects on a picture he took at his 15th birthday party and notes that in the photo, he and Haim were flanked by five of them.

\xe2\x80\x9cSlowly, over a period of many years,\xe2\x80\x9d he writes, \xe2\x80\x9cI would begin to realize that many of the people I had surrounded myself with were monsters.\xe2\x80\x9d

It got so bad that after fleeing Ron\xe2\x80\x99s clutches one night only to have another adult male friend attempt to molest him right after, he escaped to the only safe and friendly place he knew.

\xe2\x80\x9cI was shattered, disgusted, devastated. I needed some normalcy in my life. So, I called Michael Jackson,\xe2\x80\x9d he writes. \xe2\x80\x9cMichael Jackson\xe2\x80\x99s world, crazy as it sounds, had become my happy place. Being with Michael brought me back to my innocence. When I was with Michael, it was like being 10 years old again.\xe2\x80\x9d

Surprisingly, his friendship with Jackson \xe2\x80\x94 who, he makes very clear, never touched him sexually or even tried to \xe2\x80\x94 includes some of the book\xe2\x80\x99s lightest passages.

Introduced by mutual friend Spielberg, the two became close friends, and Feldman got to know Jackson\xe2\x80\x99s playful side. When they spoke on the phone, Jackson would put on voices, including \xe2\x80\x9can imitation of what sounded like an uptight, conservative Caucasian, not unlike [when] Dave Chappelle . . . pretends to be white.\xe2\x80\x9d

The pair confided in each other about their respective childhood traumas, with Feldman noting that even then, Jackson was \xe2\x80\x9cstill absolutely terrified of his father.\xe2\x80\x9d

And when they decided to take a trip to Disneyland, Feldman discovered that Jackson kept a secret penthouse apartment on Wilshire Boulevard in Westwood, for the sole purpose of housing the many disguises he used when going out in public.

Sadly, the friendship ended in 2001, when Jackson heard a rumor that Feldman was planning to trash him in a book. Despite Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s adamant denials, Jackson shut him out, and the two never spoke again.

Corey Gone Wild

Far sadder was his friendship with Haim, a brotherhood bonded by terrors. From that first meeting, when Feldman had to explain to his new friend that having sex with grown men was \xe2\x80\x9cnot what kids do, man,\xe2\x80\x9d the two shared their best and worst moments.

Publicly, they made nine films and starred in one TV series, the reality show \xe2\x80\x9cThe Two Coreys,\xe2\x80\x9d together and had their partying antics heavily documented in the press. But privately, these antics were driven by the darkest of secrets.

From early on, whenever they hung out, Haim would beg Feldman to find him someone to have sex with, harping endlessly on, \xe2\x80\x9cI need a girl. I need a girl right now. Can you call a girl for me? Come on, man. I just need somebody to take care of me.\xe2\x80\x9d

One time, Haim was so horny that he again tried to hook up with Feldman. Wanting to deflect his attention, Feldman writes, he referred Haim to a man he refers to as Tony Burnham who he knew had a crush on Haim, and Burnham became in Haim\xe2\x80\x99s life similar to what Ron was in Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s.

The boys\xe2\x80\x99 lives became so deranged that when Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s father kicked him out of the house, the only person Feldman had to turn to was Burnham, and he rationalized it because \xe2\x80\x9che was the only person in my immediate circle who wasn\xe2\x80\x99t molesting me.\xe2\x80\x9d

Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s cocaine use, which began when he once found his mother\xe2\x80\x99s stash, found him snorting an eight ball \xe2\x80\x94 an eighth of an ounce \xe2\x80\x94 every two days, a habit helped along by his new friendship with comedy party monster Sam Kinison. Together, the two smoked bales of weed in Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s trailer, and were \xe2\x80\x9chaving regular coke-off challenges, daring each other to see who can stay up the longest, who can do the most rails.\xe2\x80\x9d

In the ensuing years, Haim spiraled hard, even once being caught asking high-school students where he could buy crack.

His career in tatters, Haim rehabbed and relapsed several times, and died of pneumonia in 2010 at age 38.

Hell of Child Stars

Feldman\xe2\x80\x99s spiral was harsh as well. His heroin habit \xe2\x80\x94 Ron had introduced him to that drug and crack \xe2\x80\x94 grew to $300 a day and precipitated several arrests. By 1990, he was \xe2\x80\x9cselling my CDs on a corner in exchange for crack rocks.\xe2\x80\x9d

While attempts at sobriety proved challenging, he writes that since a severe but short relapse in 1995, he \xe2\x80\x9cnever had another hard drug again.\xe2\x80\x9d

These days, Feldman still acts \xe2\x80\x94 often in low-budget horror films \xe2\x80\x94 and performs music with his band, Truth Movement. He also has a 9-year-old son named Zen from his second marriage, to Playboy model Susie Sprague, which ended in 2009.

After all he went through, Feldman has blunt words for those who propose to drag their children through show business.

\xe2\x80\x9cPeople always ask me about life after childhood stardom. What would I say to parents of children in the industry?\xe2\x80\x9d he writes. \xe2\x80\x9cMy only advice, honestly, is to get these kids out of Hollywood and let them lead normal lives.\xe2\x80\x9d'
